head_text.subj: DOWNTOWN BOSTON

text: As we open we see the inside of an enormous church. A you looking PRIEST in his mid-thirties is finishing the deliv of the Lords Prayer. In the back of the church, in the la pew, there are two who kneel on the cold, stone floor. They do not stand to sing, nor do they offer signs of pea when told, but they pray. They grip and rub their rosarie They mutter their words in Latin. CONNOR and MURPHY MacMANUS (mid-twenties) are shrouded in thick waist length navy P-coats, worn leather boots and t hungry clothes of the poor. The boys heads are shaved and they have facial hair.
(dismissing young  priest) Thank you Father Macklepenny, for  coming all the way across town to be  our guest speaker today. I hope you  found our little parish to your  liking.

Macklepenny takes his seat on the alter along side the re priests of the church. The MacManus brothers suddenly sta as all others remain seated. Each church goer between the and the aisle shifts his/her position to allow the boys  passage, as if on command. The two turn and begin to stri for the alter, eyes down, determined.

(thick Irish accent) They've never been like anyone else.  From the moment they were born, of  the same womb, on the same day, they  just had their own way, my boys did.  And I always knew that one day they  would do something of true greatness.  I just never expected they would  bring about such a... such a  reckoning.

The MacManus brothers are fraternal twins. As Annabelle  MacManus speaks, Macklepenny is taken aback as he scans t congregation amazed to find that he is the only one who t this out of the ordinary. The monsignor begins his sermon. Macklepenny rises to sto the boys from this disgraceful disturbance. The elder clergyman finds Macklepenny's arm, keeping him  seated while shaking his head. Macklepenny's confusion gi way to awe as he watches the brothers step onto the altar brush by the six seated priests, and approach the enormou crucifix. They both fall to their knees and kiss the feet of Christ They rise and as abruptly as they came, they turn and hea back down the aisle for the front door. They stop at the  rear of the church, turning to listen to the sermon.

(loud, authoritative) ...and I am reminded of this holy  day of the sad story of Kitty  Geneviese. This poor soul cried out  time and time again for help but no  person answered her calls. Though  many saw, not one so much as called.  Her assailant wiped the bloody knife  off on her lifeless little body.  They watched as he simply walked  away. Nobody wanted to get involved.  Nobody wanted to take a stand... We  must fear evil men and deal with  them accordingly but what we must  truly guard against, what we must  fear most (beat) Is the indifference of good men.
The MacManuses turn and walk out the door.

head_text.subj: EXT. CHURCH STEPS SUNNY MORNING

text: The boys put on their dark glasses and pause at the top o the steps to light up their cigarettes. They both roll th cigarette butts along their tongues and screw them into t lips. In this unique way they light up, seemingly oblivio to their synchronicity and mimic.
(Irish accent) I do believe the Monsignor finally  got a point.
(Irish accent) Aye.
They leave.

Murphy, wearing a white blood soaked smock and apron stan around the corner of the entrance to the loading dock. He grips a gigantic, bloody slab of meat and smirks. Connor  flips his cigarette out the loading dock and passes his  brother's hiding place. He notices the workers have stopp and are looking at him.
What?

Murphy slaps Connor square in the face with the bloody sl Connor's face is caked with blood as he stands stunned. H then leaps on Murphy, sending him into a pile of nearby  hamburger. He grabs a large cow tongue from a nearby heap and begins slapping Murphy in the face with it as they bo laugh and the workers cheer. Their boss, McGERKIN approaches with a very large woman. Her head is clean-shaven. The two are still laughing, out breath, they turn.
Boys this is Rose, Baum, Gurtle...  Gurtle.
Rozengurtle Baumgartner.
You'll be training her today, and do  a good job.
Aye.
(wipes hand and extends  it) Pleased ta meet ya Rozie.
She points to a tattoo on her neck that reads untouched b man.
I prefer to be called Rozengurtle by  men.
(taken aback) Okay then... let's get ya started.
Connor exits with Roz.
Christ, that's the largest woman  I've ever seen.
It's self-imposed affirmative action.  If we hire big, fat, angry lesbians,  then the leftist groups representing  big, fat angry lesbians, won't think  we're violating their rights.
Well, how politically correct you  are. That's good stuff.
Hey, those people can shut ya down.  They'll sue you into the ground  claiming they were put under mental  duress, inner pain. and sufferin'.
Well, as long as we're hirin' fat  lesbians, give your ma a call.
Murphy laughs as he jogs away.
Fuck you Murphy.

head_text.subj: INT. NOLAND'S MEAT PACKING PLANT CUT STATION SAME DAY

text: Rozengurtle and Connor stand in front of a bunch of co-wo who are cutting meat as it goes by on assembly.
Okay, just cut off as much fat as  you can as it goes by and the rule  of thumb here is...
Rule of thumb?
(questioningly) Yeah?
Do you know where that term comes  from? In the early 1900's it was  legal for men to beat their wives as  long as they used a stick no wider  than their thumb.
Connor holds up his thumb and stares at it.
Can't do much damage with that.  Perhaps, it shoulda been the rule of  wrist. Ha! (he elbows her) Rule of wrist.

She returns an icy stare. He hands her the knife. The co- workers all seem wary of Roz. Murphy stands on one side of Roz, Connor on the other,  surrounded by a tight group of workers. Everyone is withi ear shot of one another, cutting meat as it goes by. Know glances are shared by everyone. It is an uncomfortable mo
Hey Murphy?
Aye.
(slight smirk) How many feminists does it take to  screw in a light bulb?
How many?
Two. One ta screw it in and one ta  suck my cock.
Everyone burst out laughing. Rozengurtle jabs a knife in piece of meat and turns to Connor. She pushes him and sta walking toward him. He starts backing up, laughing.
(angry) I knew you two pricks would give me  problems. Give me shit cause I'm a  woman. I'm not gonna take your male  dominance bullshit!
(trying to calm her,  but still chuckling) Oh, come on now Rozengurtle. I was  just tryin' ta get a rise outta ya.
Yeah. Just tryin' ta break the ice  is all.
(to Murphy) Fuck you... (to Connor) ...and fuck you!
Oh, come on its St. Patty's Day.  It's all in good fun.
Employees gather around all the excitement.
Baumgartner sound Irish to you, fuck  face?
Now look Rozengurtle, we're sorry.  Just relax.
She reaches back and punches Connor full force in the fac He takes the hit very well. He stops backing up.
Why don't you save all your aggression  for protests and marches and what  not.
She suddenly drives her boot into his crotch, sending him the floor reeling with pain. Two female co-workers leap t his aid.
You fuckin' slaves. Kowtowing to the  needs of men! Get up! Get the fuck  up! Leave him there.
Rozengurtle begins to turn, raising her fist to Murphy. Murphy winds up and punches her square in the face. She l on her back. The on-lookers are stunned as he walks over stands above her.
Guess you'll have ta change that  tattoo now, won't ya Rozie!?

head_text.subj: INT. HALLWAY MACMANUS' TENEMENT APT BUILDING DAY

text: The brothers get to the top of the stairs. Connor is hunc over and moving slowly. Murphy giggles.
Fuck you.

Connor flicks his cigarette butt out the large open loadi doors at the end of the hall. The red brick buildings str down the alley both ways. The glowing butt falls to a fil resting place, directly next to a dented green dumpster w half the paint job scraped off.

head_text.subj: INT. CONNOR AND MURPHY'S APARTMENT EARLY EVENING

text: This is a decrepit, illegal loft. The boys enter, hang th rosaries by the door and begin taking off their clothes. Connor sits naked on the couch and gently places a bag of ice on his crotch. Murphy stands naked in the open quanti shower. Murphy turns on the water and sticks his hand in stream.

head_text.subj: INT. CONNOR AND MURPHY'S APT EARLY EVENING

text: Connor, still seated, cracks open a Guinness and sips it  lovingly. The phone rings.
Hello.
Connor, is that you?
Something is obviously wrong in her voice.
(interested) Mother, is that you?
Is that worthless brother of your  there? I want you both ta hear this.
Ma, what's wrong?
Murphy shuts off the water.
No fuckin' hot water man. That...
Shut it. It's Ma.
Murphy sees the concern in Connor's eyes and takes a step closer.

It's all your fault. Both you little  bastards. I was a fool to believe  you would bring me any peace. The  day your Da left us when you were  almost too young to remember, he  said the two of you would do me right  and make me proud, but he was wrong  and I got nothin' ta live for.
Mother, what are you sayin'? You're  talkin' crazy here.
Murphy is drawing closer with concern.
What's the matter with her?

head_text.subj: INT. ANNABELLE MACMANUS' HOUSE IRELAND NIGHT

text: A wrinkly female hand grabs a large revolver resting next a half empty bottle of Hennessey.
I finally found your Da's army  revolver, Connor.

head_text.subj: INT. CONNOR AND MURPHY'S APT EARLY EVENING

text: What the hell are you doin' with  Da's gun!?
(widening eyes) What the...?
I got it ta my head now. I got it ta my head now.
What?! What are you doin'?
I want ta tell ya one last thing  before I pull the trigger.
(screaming) Pull the trigger?! Have ya lost it  woman?! Now just calm down here.
(eyes widen) Oh my god!
No ma! No!
BLAME...
Oh Jesus, No! No! Oh God! No Ma!
YOU...!
Connor and Murphy are both screaming in panic.

head_text.subj: EXT. ANNABELLE MACMANUS' BACK STOOP NIGHT

text: Mom stands on the back stoop holding the door ajar with h hip. She holds the phone receiver up in her left hand and the gun directly next to it, in her right. She squeezes o a loud shot toward the heavens.

head_text.subj: INT. CONNOR AND MURPHY'S APT EARLY EVENING

text: As soon as the deafening sound pierces through the receiv Connor instinctively jumps up to a standing position. The bag of ice bursts as it hits the floor and spreads across it. He throws the receiver and covers his ears with both  hands. The phone then falls to the ground, skipping through the  cubes as the boys dive for it screaming. The two naked,  hysterical boys fumble for the phone, flailing on their  stomachs in the field of ice. They finally catch it and b put their ears to the receiver in panic. As they scream M intermittently, the pauses get longer and longer.

head_text.subj: INT. ANNABELLE MACMANUS' APARTMENT NIGHT

text: Mom's got her hand covering her mouth, face red from hold back laughter, as she walks back into the house. She can  take it no longer and she bursts out with hearty guffaws.

head_text.subj: INT. CONNOR AND MURPHY'S APARTMENT EARLY EVENING

text: The boys are relieved, but angry.
(grabs his balls,  rolls over) Aaaww, shit!... evil woman!
Lord have mercy. That was a good one  ma.
Oh, Jesus! No ma! Christ ma! No!
Murphy holds the receiver in the air. Mom's still laughin
(to Connor) Oh, she's quite proud of herself.
Okay, seriously, both you listen ta  me now.
They both put an ear to the phone.
All right, we're both here.
Mom pauses and cackles endlessly once again.
(finally) It's only 11:00 here boys so I got  lot's more drinkin' ta do with your  worthless relatives down at the Anvil.
Just called ta torture us did ya?
How's Uncle Sibeal?
Well, you know how it is with him.  Always complainin' he's never turnin'  a profit on St. Patty's. Whole damn  family goes down there with no money,  cause we know he can't bear ta charge  us.
They all laugh.
But he's been havin' himself a nip  or two as well... Been up the  waitress' skirt all night, poor girl.
Well you tell him ta take it easy  with that. He's gotta learn ta respect  women the way Connor does.
Oh, Jesus.
I gave him his first lesson in  sensitivity toward the fairer sex  just today.
Don't even do it, ya bastard.
(laughs) He got beat up by a girl.
If that was a girl I want ta see  some papers. She had ta be just  preoperative for Christ sakes.
(dogmatically) Lord's name.
(genuflecting,  impassionate) Mother Mary, full of grace.
What did you do, Connor?
Well, we tried ta make friends and  she gave me a shot ta the nuts.
(aghast) What... the dirty bitch! I hope ya  trounced her a good one!
Well, I didn't but...
(shaking his fist) Don't worry, I respected the hell  out of her for ya, Ma.
Mom laughs.
Well listen, I know how my boys take  ta scrappin' when they take ta  drinkin'.
(semi-condescending) Yes mother.

(light-hearted anger) I mean it now. I carried the two of  you little bastards around in my  belly at the same time you ungrateful  pissants. Ya ruined my girlish figure  in one fell swoop, and then ya sucked  me dry. (grabbing her breast) My tits are saggin' down ta my ankles.  I trip over em for Christ sakes, now  ya listen ta me, NO FIGHTEN!
The boys laugh.
Promise me boys.
We promise.
Yeah, we promise.
Well, there's my boys. (pulls back curtain,  looks out window) Shit. I gotta go. Looks like I caused  a ruckus with that shot. Half the  damn neighborhood is comin'.
All right, love ya ma. Listen, before  ya go just give us the goods, eh?
Yeah. It's been twenty-seven years.
Still bickerin' over that, huh?
Come on, ma. Out with it. Who came  out first?
All right, I suppose you have the  right ta know.
The boys stand shoulder to shoulder, naked. They peer int the distance, ears to the phone, awaiting this most impor information.
Are ya ready?
Aye.
Slight pause as mom slams a shot of Hennessey.
(yells) The one with the biggest cock!
Mom slams down the phone and lets out a throaty laugh. Th boys sign angrily. Connor walks over and hangs up the pho
Crazy woman.
When he turns, he notices Murphy is fixated on his brothe crotch. A triumphant smile spreads across his face.
Don't start. I've had ice on mine.

head_text.subj: EXT. AN ALLEY MORNING

text: PAUL SMECKER, F.B.I. agent, is lead by the Boston Chief o Police through a jungle of ravenous reporters, police lin and uniformed officers. He is impeccably dressed in a dee red suit. He is smiling, confident as he walks. He is a v good-looking, slender man. He looks intently, for a moment, at four uniformed office They approach two dead bodies, laying next to a dented gr dumpster with half the paint job scraped off. One man, IVAN CHECKOV, lays on his stomach, closer to the dumpster than the other. The ass of his pants has been bu out and a large cotton bandage is in its place. The other, VLADDY, has a blood soaked bandage around his  head and is on his stomach as well. There are hundreds of pieces of porcelain of various sizes everywhere. Three pl clothed homicide detectives, DUFFY, DOLLY and GREENLY hov close to the bodies. Dolly and Duffy listen to GREENLY, a obvious rookie, give his over-confident theory of what to place. The chief is about to interrupt them, but Smecker holds h back with a smile. The two wait and watch in a position,  where the unsuspecting detectives have their backs to the

(thick Boston accent) ...so these guys are just kickin'  the shit out of each other. This guy  (points to Vladdy) Picks up an old kitchen sink that  some one threw out and crushes this  guy  (Checkov) With it. All right, so it makes a  big bang and alerts their friend,  who's standin' look out around the  corner. So he comes over and gets  into it with this guy,  (Vladdy) He's angry at him, right? They get  into an altercation in which the  look out guy crushes this guy by  jumpin on him. And look at the damage  here. (Vladdy) I mean this guy's fuckin' hamburger  man. His spine is crushed. He's all  twisted and shit. That guy had to be  one big mother fucker. Huge, 3-400  pounds, fuckin huge.
Smecker listens. The Chief is embarrassed.

Or, okay. Check this out. Say these  two don't even know the huge guy.  They're just staggerin' home from a  bar this morning, still all fucked  up from St. Patty's last night. So  they figure they'll take a short cut  down the alley and this big mother  fucker, he's just waitin'. And what  could be more perfect for strong arm  robbery? Two drunk guys all bandaged  up. They're already injured for Christ  sakes. He takes a blunt object and  whacks the guy with the bandage on  his head, right? Cause he's smart.  He knows the guy with the bandage on  his ass, he ain't going nowhere.  Matter of fact, this guy's probably  helping his friend with the rectal  problem along. They're limping around  like a couple of decrepit old broads.  So once this guy's out of the picture (denotes Vladdy) this poor asshole, he tries to run.  But look how far he gets fore the  huge bastard catches up with him.  Only a few yards. And what does he  do? He gets creative. He picks up a  sink and crushes the poor mother- fucker. Then, he ain't done yet. He  comes over here, jumps on this guy's  back and crushes him to death. (Vladdy) He steals their shit and beats it!  Thanks for comin' out! (beat) And look at this print...
Greenly points out a large foot print on Vladdy's back. Some detectives nod in agreement. Smecker chuckles as he  shakes his head.

That's one big fuckin' shoe!... and  think about it. Of all the ways to  kill a guy, crushin' him to death.  That's very particular. You don't  get many of those. I dunno. I feel  something big here. I wouldn't be  surprised if we see more of these  turning up.
(stepping into the  open) Brilliant. So now we got a Huge guy  theory and Serial crusher theory.  Top fucking notch. (to Greenly) What's your name?
Detective Greenly. Who the fuck are  you?
Smecker saunters up to Greely and pulls his I.D. out of t breast pocket of his sport coat and lets it hang. The lar light blue letters, F.B.I. can be easily seen.
That's who the fuck I am.
All the detectives seem disgruntled and look to the Chief for an explanation.

Listen, I gotta go by the numbers on  this one. I.D. just came back on  these guys. They've got connections  to the Russian mob. That makes it a  federal matter and Agent Smecker,  here, is heading up the investigation  with our full cooperation.
(transfixed on Greely) Why don't you get me a cup of coffee.
What the fuck?
Cafe latte.
Who the...
Twist of lemon!
(to Chief) Chief, what the fuck is this?
Sweet-n-low!

Greenly looks helplessly to the Chief, who simply nods. H storms off the scene, upset. Smecker turns his back on  everyone and puts earphones in. He reaches down and hits  play. The choir song "Agnus dei" overtakes. He begins to  investigate. He kneels at the bodies for a moment then st at the opposite brick wall. He picks up a piece of porcel and scrapes it with his thumb. He quickly cocks his head toward the sky and begins to ch as he says Jesus Christ, under his breath. He brushes som paraffin on each of the dead men's hands. Duffy and Dolly watch defiantly. They start to smile at one another as th collectively realize his homosexuality. He is slightly  effeminate buy not overly fey.
(loudly) Mitchell, Langley!
Two uniformed officers approach.
Yes sir.

Find the manager of this building.  See if he has had any complaints of  water coming down in any apartments,  starting just this morning. If he's  not there, knock on every door  starting from the third floor up.  Langley, you take this building,  same thing.
Mitchell and Langley exit.
Chaffey, Newman.
Two more uniforms approach.
Yes sir.

(to Chaffey) Look in the trash around their hands.  See if you can find me two bullet  casings. 45's, if my eye serves me  right. Don't disturb them. Mark them  as they lay. Newman, root through  this shit. (points to the mountain  of garbage) If this was a sink find me some metal  parts. Gimme a faucet or a drain  cover or something.
The two begin their tasks. Chaffey finds a casing near  Checkov's hand, hidden under the edge of the pile.
Got it. It's a 45.
The homicide detectives are surprised as Chaffey looks fo the second shell. Smecker lights up a smoke.
Chief, could you get ballistics down  here and tell them they have to dig  a 45 slug out of a brick wall.
He points to a bullet hole in the opposing and tattered w
...and locate another that's been  fired through a dumpster.
He points to another bullet hole at the dumpster's base.
I got the best ballistics guy in the  world. He's mobile. Got all his stuff  right in the van. Can have him down  here in 10 minutes.
How did you know that?
Paraffin came up positive. And bullet  holes are usually a big clue.
I can't find the second one, sir.
Look under the body.
(obeys) Got it.
Smecker turns to detectives with a smirk.
You guy's ready for this?
They both nod.

This was no gangland assassination.  Though creative, it was way too  sloppy. Something went wrong here.  This has personal written all over  it. Now, these men were crushed and  the first natural reaction the body  has to such trauma is to tense up.  So now the two shots fired here were  reflex rounds. These guys weren't  shooting at anything, but they were  just about to.
Mitchell returns.

Agent Smecker, (pointing to MacManus  building) This is all illegal loft housing so  there's no manager on the premises  but I found a lady on the fourth  floor said she's had water dripping  down on her whole place. Started  just this morning.
Fourth floor huh? Then we're heading  to the fifth. Let's go up and see  just how right I am.

head_text.subj: INT. MACMANUS' APT. BUILDING FIRST FLOOR MORNING

text: The detectives pile into the elevator, Smecker last. Gree has rejoined them. Smecker sips his latte.
So what are you thinkin' here?
Really want to know?
All the detectives chant the affirmative. The doors close

location: MACMANUS' APT. BUILDING ELEVATOR FIFTH FLOOR MORN

text: As the doors open, all the detectives chorus their disbel
No way. You know how big a guy's  gotta be to do that? Fuckin' huge.
Smecker turns to Greenly in disbelief.
(beat) Oooo. I might be wanting a bagel  with my coffee.
Smecker exits the elevator leaving the three silent detec with that thought.
(to Dolly) I ain't getting him no fuckin' bagel.
The detectives exit the elevator.

location: MACMANUS' DOORWAY INSIDE APT LOOKING OUT TO HALL

head_text.subj: MORNING

text: Smecker appears first, glancing in momentarily. The detec pile in behind him. They survey the situation in total aw
(to Greenly) We'll start the ass kissing with  you.

head_text.subj: EXT. MACMANUS' APT. BUILDING FRONT STEPS MORNING

text: Smecker saunters out, detectives on his heels.
(approaches Smecker) Agent Smecker. I know this  neighborhood pretty good. There's a  bar called McGinty's down the block.  It's a good bet they were there last  night.
(turns to detectives) Good work, Mitchell. I'll check that  out myself.
Duffy starts walking down the street. A REPORTER is hot o his heels.
Hey, Duffy. What the fuck happened  here? You owe me. This is the one I  want.
Let's go get a cup of coffee. You  ain't gonna fuckin' believe this  one.
Smecker is standing on the front steps in front of unifor officers and homicide detectives.
I want A.P.B.'s put out. I want more  uniforms on the streets. One thing's  for sure, wherever these guys are  they're hurting.

head_text.subj: INT. EMERGENCY ROOM DAY

text: A potent song takes our ears as The MacManus brothers sit the E.R. They have already received care. Their faces are beaten and there are bandages and dried blood in various  spots. Connor's injuries exceed Murphy's. They are both c in only their leather boots, boxer shorts and worn out ol bathrobes. Young kids wait for medical attention, as their knife wou bleed. Two nuns in the corner console a third, whose robe are ripped and face is beaten. A woman toward the end of hall is so badly beaten she is unrecognizable. As the song builds to a more harrowing chorus, a man ente His clothes suggest he's a pimp. He is not injured. He lo around as he stands, perturbed, at the end of the hall. He reaches over and grabs the beat up woman by the hair a begins to drag her out. She is kicking and screaming from the floor, grabbing at his wrists as he hauls her away. (Slo-mo) The boys, instantly furious, stand and begin to toward the action, but Connor's legs give out on him and falls to the floor. Connor, still trying to go after the  pimp, crawls towards him. Murphy helps his brother to his chair and hold him tight.
Okay. Just calm down. Take it easy.  He'll have his day. He'll have his (turns) FUCKIN' DAY!
Music fades.

head_text.subj: INT EMERGENCY ROOM DAY FEW MINUTES LATER

text: An old Irishman enters the E.R. DOC (70 yrs.) has a serio facial twitch and is prone to blinking uncontrollably. He has a mild stutter. He also has Tourette's Syndrome and i apt to yell his two chosen swear words every now and then first fuck! and after a slight pause, ass! He rushes up a they stand to greet him. Murphy holds Connor up.
Thanks for comin', Doc.
(Irish accent, squeaky  voice) J-Jesus. What the fuck happened? Are  ya b-boys all right?
We're alive.
An F.B.I. agent came by the bar. He  left me his c-c, he left me his c-c,  he left me this.
He hands them a card with Smecker's name on it. They surv it with interest.
(extremely loud) Fuck!..........Ass!
Everyone in the E.R. looks at Doc in shock. Connor and Mu don't even avert their eyes from the card.
What are you going to do?
We're going to turn ourselves in. It  was self defense.
y-y-yeah that's what he said.
How the fuck's he know that? We  haven't spoken to anyone yet.
Don't know. He didn't say.
The boys look puzzled. Murphy helps Connor down to his se
Listen Doc, we need a favor.
A-anything.
Murphy hands Doc a partially filled garbage bag.
Hold this shit for us, Doc. We'll be  comin back for it when we get out.
Right.
Doc exits, say one more "Fuck,...Ass", on the way out.

head_text.subj: INT. BOSTON POLICE STATION PRECINCT OFFICE DAY

text: The station is abuzz with the story. Connor and Murphy's  names are on all tongues. A legend starts. Every availabl officer is in the room along with the homicide detectives Smecker walks right down the middle.

First of all, I'd like to thank  whichever one of you donut munching,  barrel-assed dip-shits leaked this  to the press. That's just what we  need now, some sensational story in  the papers making these guys out to  be super heroes, triumphing over  evil. And let me squash the rumors  now. These two aren't heroes. (rolls his eyes) They are two ordinary men who were  put in an extraordinary situation  and they just happened to come out  on top. Yes, nothing from our far  reaching computer system has turned  up jack shit on these two. All we  know is what we found out from their  neighbors. And the general consensus  is that they're... angels. (pause) But angels don't kill and we got two  bodies in the morgue that look like  they've been...
Smecker looks to Greenly. Dripping with sarcasm.
...serial crushed by a huge fuckin'  guy.
Some of the cops and homicide detectives laugh and chide  Greenly.
Are these me considered armed and  dangerous?
Well, not armed. If they had guns,  they'd have used them. But dangerous?  Oh yeah.
What makes you think they're  dangerous? They were just protecting  each other.

head_text.subj: EXT. BOSTON POLICE STATION STEPS DAY

text: The two are limping up the precinct stairs. Connor is dra over Murphy who helps his brother along, they are still  attired as in the E.R.

head_text.subj: INT. BOSTON POLICE STATION PRECINCT OFFICE DAY

text: Look, look! I'm not saying one way  or the other. Just be careful and go  by the protocol on this one.
Any tips on where these guys may be?
(to Officer Mitchell) Any word back from the E.R.s?
No help at all. Swamped from St.  Patty's. Packed with drunk, bloody  Irish.
Just hit the bricks nice and hard.
Grunt police work is going to bring this one in.
(talking loudly) These guys are miles away by now.
The brothers quietly enter in the back of the room. All t officers are seated with their backs to them. Smecker and the brothers make eye contact. He knows who they are. The don't interrupt Greenly.

But if you want to beat your head  against a wall, then here's what you  look for. These guys are scared like  two little bunny rabbits. Anything  in a uniform or flashing blue lights  will spook them. So the only thing  we can do is put a potato on a string  and drag it through South Boston.
There is light chuckling from the police at this crack.
(loud) You'd probably have better luck with  a beer.
Everyone turns and looks.

head_text.subj: INT. INTERROGATION ROOM BOSTON POLICE STATION LATER

text: The boys sit in two chairs at a plain table with a record device on it. They are very serious and alert. Mitchell e with coffee for them. He shakes their hands and says he r respects what they did. Surprised, they thank him. Chaffe enters with donuts and a repeat performance of respect. S officers start to gather around the interrogation room do

head_text.subj: INT. INTERROGATION ROOM BOSTON POLICE STATION DAY LATER

text: There are at least 20 officers and detectives packed in t tiny room. The MacManus' visit with the excited cops. All are in high spirits. The room is loud as Smecker walks in.
What the fuck is this!? This isn't a  fuckin' tea party. Get out! Only  thing I want in here is them.
They all file out. Smecker and the boys look each other o
This conversation is going to be  recorded. Just answer to the best of  your knowledge.
Smecker reaches for the record button. Murphy puts out hi hand to stop him.
(politely) Excuse me, sir.
Murphy turns to his brother and speaks in Latin, in hushe tones. It is subtitled in English.
"What do we tell him about the guns  and money?"
"We just got up and left. Bum musta  rolled them before the police got  there."
(to Smecker) Okay. We're ready.
Smecker in intrigued with this tiny display. He hits the  record button.
You guys are not under oath, here. I  am assuming you knew these two guys  from before, huh?
We... met them last night.
They had some pretty interesting  bandages. Know anything about that?
They look at each other.

head_text.subj: FLASHBACK. INT MCGINTY'S PUB NIGHT ST. PATRICK'S DAY

text: McGinty's's is packed to the walls with drunken Irish. A of faces are recognizable from Noland's Meat. Connor is i front of the bar. He and Doc are staring at each other as waiting for one man to give in. Connor has his arms acros the chests of Murphy and some friends, holding them in pl They are interested in the competition. PRESENTLY...
(presently, imitating  Doc's voice) Would someone please come over here  and...
Fuck!
me up the...
Ass!

Everyone falls down laughing. Doc is angry and starts thr ice at them. DAVID DELLA ROCCO makes his way through the  crowd. Rocco is thirty-two years old. He has shoulder-len dark hair and a full beard and mustache that wrap around big smile. He charges up to the bar and yells to Doc.
Hey! Fuck! Ass! Get me a beer!

This sends everyone even further into laughter. Doc throw two huge fists full of ice at him. He backs away laughing The boys get up off the floor and have a huge group hug w Rocco as they all scream each others names. They all laugh and commence drinking.

head_text.subj: INT. MCGINTY'S PUB NIGHT

text: The bar is trashed. It's mostly empty now except for the  brothers, Rocco, Doc and four friends. Everyone is very d including Doc.
(trying to connect  with Connor) ...It's not that I'm homophobic. I'm  just afraid of faggots.
Connor pauses then bursts out laughing. Doc calls everyon to gather round.

I got some bad news. Looks like I'm  gonna have ta close d-down the bar.  The Russians have been buying up  buildings all over town, including  this one... Fuck!... Ass! And they're  not letting me renew my lease. I got  'til the end of the week to come up  with 26,000 dollars, or they take  the place. I left them a note telling  them not to show their faces t- tonight. They been pressuring me ta  close and take the last few days ta  get all my shit outta here but it's  my right to stay open ta the last.
Long pause as everyone absorbs. They are upset.
Let me talk to my boss, may I can...
He is cut off by everyone who obviously opposes Mafia  involvement.
L-l-listen I don't want anyone ta  know until the last possible moment.  So you guys keep your traps shut. ya  know what they say; People in glass  houses sink ships.
Everyone has quizzical looks on their faces.
Y'know Doc, I gotta get you a, a,  like a proverb book or something.  This mix and match shit's gotta go.
What?
Everyone chuckles.
(imitating Doc) A p-penny saved is worth two in the  bush.
(imitating Doc) Don't c-cross the road if ya can't  get out of the kitchen.

Everyone laughs heartily. Just then, three large Russians suits enter. The obvious leader, CHECKOV, stands in front with VLADDY behind one of Checkov's shoulders, with anoth guy behind the other shoulder. They mean business. The  laughter fades.
(thick Russian accent) I am Ivan Checkov. You will be closing  now.
(after a long pause) This is McCoy... we find Spock and  we got enough for an away team.
Everyone laughs. Ivan is angry.

Oh, how extraordinary. A bunch of  Irishmen... and they are being drunken  idiots. You are killing the  stereotype. I'm in no mood for  discussion. (points to Doc) You! You stay. The rest of you go  now.
Why don't you make like a tree and  get the fuck outta here!
The locals roll their eyes at Doc's blunder.
Calm down, Doc. I'm sure they're  reasonable fellows.
He and Murphy each grab a Guinness and a shot of Hennesse and they approach the Russians with the peace offering.
Listen fellas, Y'know he's got 'til  this week's end. Ya don't have ta be  hard asses, do ya?
Yeah, it's St. Patty's day. Everyone's  Irish tonight. Now, why don't ya  pull up a stool and have a drink  with us?
You insult me. I would never drink  that sewage. Especially with you  people. You are fools.
Checkov slaps the beer to the floor.
This is no game! If you won't go, we  will make you go!
The boys look at each other, remembering what Mom said. They still hold the shots.
If ya want a fight, you can see you're  outnumbered. We're trying ta be civil  here, so I suggest you take our offer.
I make the offers, ass-hole.
Rocco pushes off the bar. He's had enough.
(standing between the  two brothers) Hey, there Boris. What would you say  if I told you that your pinko, commie  mother sucked so much dick...
Wham! Ivan punches him in the face. He is quickly down an out. Connor and Murphy's faces turn to stone as they spea the next few lines in flawless fluent Russian with Englis subtitles.
"Now, that wasn't too polite, was  it?"
"I'm afraid we can't let that one  go, Ivan."
Checkov is completely taken aback. All the Irish are fair impressed as well.
I don't think Ma would mind.

They clink the glasses together, throw back the Hennessey ball up the thick glasses in their fists, drop to one kne and both deliver a devastating blow to each of Checkov's  quads. Murphy on the left, Connor on the right. He's down for the count, writhing on the floor. The boy's each take a Russian guy and start fighting as t others start kicking and spitting on Checkov. This is a b brawl, lots of punches don't connect. Connor dismantles h man quickly. Murphy is still fighting as all the Irish tr to jump in and help Murphy but Connor goes into psycho mo pushing them all back.
Let the boy go. He knows what the  fuck he's doing!

They all back off and start to cheer him on. Murphy and V are ripping each other apart. Vladdy backs him against a  wall and pulls back, exhausted, for one good punch. Murph reaches up behind his head with both hands and pulls two  bottles of wine from a wall rack. He swings them toward e other with Vladdy's head as the mid-point. The bottles  haphazardly connect, one on each side of his head. He cru to the ground in an explosion of glass and wine. There is shock and silence.
Nicely done, boy!

head_text.subj: INT. MCGINTY'S PUB NIGHT A FEW MINUTES LATER

text: They have Ivan Checkov tied down to the bar on his stomac Connor stands with an unlit cigarette dangling from his l next to Ivan. He pours Hennessey all over Checkov's butto They all cheer. Ivan's face is battered as Rocco wakes an approaches. He punches Checkov in the face in complete ra Two friends subdue him as all chuckle.
Now, like my fine brother says, on  St. Patty's everyone's Irish. And  this piece of shit is about to be  initiated.

As they cheer, Connor lights up his smoke and tosses the  match on Ivan's butt. The Hennessey is instantly ablaze and Checkov is screamin and wiggling in horror. Some just stand there stunned, bu most of the remaining onlookers leap to Ivan's aid. They  furiously pat him out and turn on Connor.
Are ya tryin' ta kill him, ya fuck?

head_text.subj: INT. CONNOR AND MURPHY'S APT EARLY NEXT MORNING

text: Connor and Murphy, fairly beat up, sit up on their beds. They wear tattered bathrobes and boxer shorts. They put t feet down into their leather boots. The boys examine the  extent of one another's injuries and reflect on their  hangovers. They both laugh and grab their heads in pain. Boom! The door breaks open and in hobbles Checkov and Vla guns drawn. Checkov is all beat up and the ass of his pan is burnt out. A bulky bandage covers his buttocks. Vladdy has a large bandage around his head. The boys stand in  surprise. Ivan smashes Connor in the forehead with his gun, sending blood gushing down his face as he falls to the floor. Mur helplessly yells his brother's name as he is brought to h knees by Vladdy. Ivan positions Connor on his knees befor the toilet, which is open to the room. Checkov puts his f on Connor's head and proceeds, as he struggles, to hand c him to the old toilet. So now Connor is bleeding and hugg the commode with his hands cuffed behind the bowl base.

(almost whispering) I was going to kill you. But I'm  not... I'm going to kill your brother.  I'm going to take him down to the  dumpster and I'm going to shoot him  in the head. Then I'm going to throw  his dead body in the garbage. (looks at this watch) Trash guys are coming in 10 minutes,  gotta go.
Checkov walks towards the door and says "let's go" to Vla
It was just a bar fight. You guys  are fuckin' pussies!

Vladdy pulls him to his feet and leads him away following Checkov. Connor, blood running from his face, listens to absolute  silence for just a moment. Suddenly his face reads the gr of the situation. In a split second he turns into an anim He's yelling, pulling, tugging and growling. His body is a whirlwind of motion. The skin on his wrists bleeds profusely.

head_text.subj: EXT. ALLEY MORNING

text: Vladdy and Checkov lead Murphy out back into the alley. Murphy is on his knees next to the dumpster. Checkov has gun to the boy's head. He acts like he's going to pull th trigger, but he stops. Vladdy is standing twenty feet awa with his back to them keeping a look out, gun in hand.

head_text.subj: INT. CONNOR AND MURPHY'S APT. MORNING

text: Connor becomes so venomous, that he pulls the entire toil right out of the floor.

head_text.subj: INT. TO EXT. MACMANUS' TENEMENT LOADING DOORS MORNING

text: (slo-mo) Connor steps out onto the sill of the huge, open loading doors. He is five stories up. His muscles ripple  with the weight of the toilet. His face is barbaric.

head_text.subj: EXT. ALLEY MORNING

text: From his kneeling position, Murphy can see his brother pe 50 feet overhead. He does not let his face betray him.
I hope your conscience is clear,  Irishman.

head_text.subj: EXT. MACMANUS' TENEMENT LOADING DOORS MORNING

text: (slo-mo) Connor bends his knees and heaves the toilet upw and swings one arm directly beneath it. He is no longer  tethered around the basin. He holds it at a cocked angle. The heavy porcelain tank cover slips off the toilet. He tosses the toilet in a left and outwardly trajectory,  then he jumps off the sill to the right. He is sailing th the air about twenty feet behind, and to the right of the toilet, cuffed hands above his head, robe up like a cape  behind him. Murphy screams

head_text.subj: EXT. ALLEY MORNING

text: (slo-mo) Checkov begins to laugh heartily. The tank top l pristinely on a garbage bag just behind Murphy. Ivan's lo turns to one of terror. Bam! He is crushed by the toilet. Boom! His gun goes off, punching a hole in the dumpster n the bottom. Vladdy hears the bang and crouches as he turn to see a wave of tiny porcelain bits. Connor lands squarely on Vladdy's back. His gun discharge firing a hole in the brick of the opposing wall. He is  savagely crushed against the ground. Connor bounces off a hits the wall, landing in the garbage completely unconsci Murphy takes his hands from his head. There is dead silen He runs to his brother, pulls him from the trash and chec his vital signs. He seems okay. Vladdy, still alive, slow crawls for his gun, inadvertently covering his own bullet casing. Murphy goes over, picks up the tank cover and clu the man to death with two hard and fast blows, then throw it up and behind him. It lands in the dumpster with a  resonating boom. Murphy quickly takes everything from the scene; guns, mon wallets, watches and a pager. He shoves it in a garbage b and throws Connor over his shoulder and runs out of the a

head_text.subj: BACK TO PRESENT. INT. BOSTON POLICE STATION INTERROGATION
ROOM AFTERNOON

text: Smecker stares astounded at Connor and Murphy. The boys  examine Smecker for a reaction. He slowly builds to a chu The brothers join in.
(gathering himself) So, how is it that you guys are fluent  in Russian?
We paid attention in school.
Know any other languages?
Aye. Our mother insisted on it.  French.
Murphy speaks flawless French with subtitles.
(subtitled) How do you think he figured all this  out without talking to us?
Italian.
Connor speaks flawless Italian with subtitles.
(subtitled) I have no idea. Maybe someone saw  and talked.
German. (subtitled) Not in our neighborhood, man. A  hundred percent Irish. No one talks  to cops. Period.
Spanish. (subtitled) Then I guess he's just real... real  good.
What are you guys doing working at a  fucking meat packing plant?
The brothers laugh. Chaffey enters.
Ah, Agent Smecker, we have a problem.
What?
The press is everywhere outside.  They're going nuts for these guys.  What do you want to do?
You're not being charged. It's up to  you. Do you want to talk to them?
Absolutely not.
No pictures, either.
Well, we could try the bag over the  head thing. Walk you right out the  front.
Our mother can see through bags.
Aye, she can.  (beat) Any way we can stay here?
Sure, we have an empty holding cell,  They can... can they stay?
Well, we'll have to check with your  mother, but it's ok with me if your  friends sleep over.
They all chuckle. Chaffey is embarrassed. Smecker stands.
Time to feed the dogs.
Smecker leaves.
He's a nice guy.
Murphy speaks with the characteristic gay man's lingering "S".
Yes... he is.
They laugh.

head_text.subj: EXT. BOSTON POLICE STATION FRONT STEPS EARLY EVENING

text: The police chief is standing on the front steps of the po station making a statement to the ravenous press: cameras and pushy reporters. Agent Smecker stands slightly behind him. Rocco stands amidst the sea of reporters as the chief beg

This is our official statement. The  MacManus brothers are not being  charged with a crime. It was a clean- cut case of self defense. We have  thanked them for their cooperation  and we thank you, the media, for  your tireless pursuit of the truth.

The press is ablaze with questions. Smecker turns and wal down the precinct steps, passing Rocco, who carries a bun of folded clothes, and heads for the police station. Smec glances in Rocco's direction, barely noticing the man who has already passed him.

head_text.subj: INT. MACMANUS' CELLS EARLY EVENING

text: Rocco approaches the wide open cell as Chaffey and Mitche play cards with the brothers. Happy to see each other the boys and Rocco embrace. He hands them their clothes.

head_text.subj: INT. MACMANUS' CELL NIGHT

text: The boys are in a tight cell with a bed on each side. The are in their own clothes now. The brothers are fast aslee Suddenly, they lurch forward, throwing their chests out,  lips tight, still asleep. INT. POLICE STATION BATHROOM  NIGHT. An officer turns on the faucet of a sink and begins to wa his hands. We go down to the pipes beneath the porcelain  basin. An old leak seeps water through a crack in the flo

head_text.subj: INT. MACMANUS' CELL NIGHT

text: A water leak starts on the ceiling. It drips faster and  faster. The water begins to follow a water damaged crack  along the ceiling. It slowly spreads in two directions. The brothers struggle for air in their sleep. Then slowly and at the same time, they each reach up one arm apiece a simultaneously curl their hands as if grabbing something. Their straining faces are brought from darkness to light they sit up quickly, face to the ceiling. Their eyes open wide and they each draw their first breat as drops of the creeping water land on their foreheads. They look at each other across the room in shock as the d of water still fall between them.
Destroy all that which is evil...
...so that which is good may flourish

head_text.subj: INT. MANMANUS' CELL NEXT MORNING

text: Murphy and Connor sleep. Murphy awakes to a beep, beep, b He removes Checkov's pager from the pocket of his bathrob

head_text.subj: INT. PRECINCT OFFICE MORNING

text: Connor and Murphy enter as Greenly, Dolly, Duffy, Chaffey and Mitchell are having coffee and donuts. They greet eac other warmly. Connor grabs a pen and walks to the hallway
Be right back...
We would be honored, sir, if you  would join us peasants, in a donut.

Duffy hands Murphy a jelly donut and a cup of coffee as D spreads a copy of the Boston Globe in front of Murphy. Th headlines read "The Saints of South Boston." All the  detectives chuckle as Murphy is momentarily absorbed. He  takes the paper.
Saints?   (beat) I will not accept this pizzle until  my feet have been properly anointed.
They laugh.

head_text.subj: INT. PRECINCT OFFICE MORNING

text: Connor cradles the receiver of a pay phone between his ch and shoulder. He pockets the pager. As the phone rings, h readies his pen. The other end of the line picks up and a thick Russian accent instantly begins speaking. Connor  responds by speaking a few words in Russian before he rea it's a recorded message. He begins writing. He hangs up t phone and smiles as he lights up a cigarette. INT. POPPA JOE YAKAVETTA'S OFFICE  DAY. A.K.A. THE JOKE. Rocco, still sporting a shiner, enters an office. There a papers everywhere and it is a cluttered mess of telephone filing cabinets, lamps and chairs. Rocco clutches a brown paper bag as if it is made of gold. POPPA JOE YAKAVETTA,  Rocco's boss, is on the phone. He is in his late forties. He's always comfortably dressed; sleeves rolled up, colla unbuttoned. VINCENZO LIPAZZI swaggers across the office to Rocco. He in his late thirties. He goes out of his way to look like Elvis; open shirt, gold chains and medallions. He is  overweight and has a bouffant hairdo, accompanied by Elvi shades. Vincenzo flips a half dollar in his hand constant Rocco and Vincenzo hate each other. Yakavetta talks on th phone.
(hushed) Well, it's the funny man. Give it  here, package boy.
(a bit defiant) Joey Bevo said it was important.  Said I had to give it to him myself.
(snatching the package) Gimme the fuckin' thing. Now sit the  fuck down!

Rocco obeys like an angry child. Vincenzo puts it in fron of Yakavetta. He sits on a filing cabinet and flips his c Vincenzo giggles and whispers as he pokes fun at Rocco. The two of them resemble kids behind the teacher's back.
(hushed) I'm Rocco. I'm the funny man. Heee  Hee. I'm so fuckin' funny. Hee Hee.
Fuck you Vincenzo.
(hushed) Tell me a joke funny man. Hee Hee.
I caught your show down at the velvet  room at the Holiday Inn, loved it  when you busted into Viva Las Vegas.
Vincenzo's face drops he gets up and starts walking towar Rocco. Roc points at him from a seated position. He's sca
Hey, hey, hey...
Suddenly Yakavetta jumps to a standing position. He yells
Fuck you! I could snap my fingers  and have you dead in four hours,  rotting in a truck off of Boyleston!  You insignificant little fuck! I  always get my fuckin' money!
He slams the phone down. Rocco and Vincenzo are shocked b try to look composed.

Fuckin' 90's are killin' me. I  shouldn't a done that. You're not  supposed to tell a guy you're gonna  kill him anymore. I gotta tip-toe  through the tulips with these  assholes. I prance. I'm a prancer.  It's what I do... sucked all the fun  right out of this job.
As he speaks he unwraps the wax paper in the bag. Rocco l over his shoulder. It's a sandwich. He's embarrassed. Vincenzo smirks at him.
Poppa Joe, you want me to go now?
Yeah. Thanks, Rocco. See ya.
Rocco starts for the door. Vincenzo begins whispering in  Yakavetta's ear.
Hey, Rocco, wait. Come back here.
Yeah boss?
Vincenzo continues whispering for a few more seconds, lon enough for Rocco to see. Vincenzo's lips are tight. His t grind.
I always see you talking to the boys  and making them laugh. They always  come around telling me what a crack  up you are. What is it they call  you?
(totally intimidated) The... The funny man.
The funny man. Well, I got a new job  for you, just for now. Roc, I'm having  a real shitty day. I'm depressed.  Tell me a funny story or a joke.

(terrified) Uh. Okay... um... you hear the one  about the, no fuck that one... uh...  oh! oh! Well... shit. Okay, there's  a white guy. He's walkin' along the  beach and he finds a, a pot, y'know  and ah, he rubs it and this genie  pops out. But this genie, he's a  ni... he's a black guy.
He's a nigger.

Yeah. And uh, he's pissed off. He  says, "Why you crackers always gotta  find my mother fuckin' pot? And he  tells him he's gonna grant all his  three wishes but he's gonna give all  the black guys...
Niggers!

Sorry! Sorry! All the niggers on the  planet get double what he wishes  for. "I'll take a million dollars,"  he says. Genie give it to him and  says every nigger on earth just got  two million. "I don't care gimme a  yacht." Poof there it is. (intimidated, losing  steam) E-every bl... every nigger just got  two yachts. Genie goes... (gives up) I'm sorry Poppa Joe. I can't. This  joke sucks.
Yakavetta takes a long pause.
Continue the joke.
(deflated) He says, "What's your third wish?"  And the guys says, "I-I want you to  beat me half to death."
There's a long tense pause. Suddenly, Yakavetta throws hi head back and roars with laughter. Vincenzo joins in. Roc lets out a semi-audible sign of relief and gradually star laughing himself.
(still in guffaw) Very good stuff, Rocco. Very good  stuff. Tell me another one.
Rocco returns to terror. Yakavetta erupts again pointing Rocco.

head_text.subj: INT COMMON BOSTON HOME ANTEROOM TWILIGHT

text: Connor and Murphy give a huge Irishman guns, money and go watches. He hands them two big black duffle bags and moti for them to help themselves as he counts the money. They  enter a well equipped arsenal. They are giddy as they go their first shopping spree. They toss in masks and gloves They toss in four identical black finished 9mm handguns w silencers.
Know what we need, man?... some rope.
For what?
Charlie Bronson's always got rope.
What?
Yeah, these guys always got a lot of  rope strapped around em in the movies  and they always end up using it.
Oh, you've lost it, haven't ya?
I'm serious.
Me too. That's stupid. Name one thing  we're gonna need it for.
I don't know they just always need  it.
What is all this "they" shit? This  ain't a movie.
Connor pulls a large hunting knife from Murphy's bag.
Is that right, Rambo?
All right, get the stupid fuckin'  rope.

head_text.subj: INT. SMECKER'S BEDROOM NIGHT

text: Paul Smecker lies in bed with his young lover, Reuben (mi twenties). He has an innocent, feminine look and a GQ air about him. The two have just had sex and Reuben is far mo excited about it than Smecker. Reuben pants and gestures that it was a wonderful experie Smecker watches TV. Reuben reaches over and affectionately places a hand on  Smecker's chest. Paul tosses it off with indifference. Reuben has a pouty look. The phone rings.
Uh,huh.  (pause) Room number.
Reuben throws an arm over Smecker's abdomen and places hi head on Paul's bare chest as if to now force affection.
We got a time of death?
He is visibly miffed with Reuben's sudden display. He tri to pull the arm away but Reuben holds tight.
(sighs) What's the body count?
Smecker is annoyed. He slaps Reuben semi-gently once on h exposed cheek. Reuben closes his eyes and holds even tigh
Uh, huh.
He bites his lower lip in anger and smack Reuben again on the same cheek, hard. Reuben jumps to a sitting position  holding his cheek. He is shocked and hurt.
I'll be down there in a bit. Keep  the press out.
He hangs up. Immediately to Reuben, semi-angry.
What are you doing?
(beat) I was just trying to cuddle.
Cuddle?...  (yelling) What a fag!

Smecker saunters down the hall, his usual confident smile He is impeccably dressed in a brightly colored suit. Gree stands directly outside an open door at the hall's end. A steady flow of detectives and forensics filter in and out Smecker halts before Greenly and looks straight into his  eyes.
(intrigued) He's struck again, hasn't he, Greenly?
Why do you always disrespect me like  that?
Respect is earned, Greenly, never  given. Guys like you should have to  follow me around squabbling for the  scraps from my table.

head_text.subj: INT. PLAZA HOTEL SUITE LIVING ROOM NIGHT

text: Smecker and Greenly walk into a large sunken living room  with high ceilings. There is a huge white shaped pit couc in the center with seven dead bodies draped across it. Al the bodies have been turned so they are either seated or their backs and bright new pennies have been place in the eyes. There is one corpse directly in the middle of the l room, making eight. This victim (THE FAT MAN) is overweig and is lying in debris made up of sheet rock and broken w which spreads thinly for a five foot radius around him. The victims' body positions are in a circle with the fat as the hub. Smecker is instantly engulfed. The regular  homicide detectives are on hand with their I.D.s hanging of their breast pockets. They see Smecker and back off. Duffy wears an especially loud tie. Smecker lights up a s He circles around and sees another body behind the couch, which makes nine. The victim is on his back, with pennies stuck in his eyes.
How many bodies, Greenly?
(still Dejected) Eight.
Smecker's eyes widen as he turns to Greenly.
(catching himself) No! Shit! I didn't see that one.  Nine! Nine!
Smecker takes a beat. He addresses the detectives.
While Greenly's getting coffee,  anybody else want anything?
(as he walks to the  door) Shit! Shit!
Smecker surveys the scene.
So Duffy, got any theories to go  with that... tie.
(looks down) These guys were pros. I think they  were coming for one target, the fag  man, he was the...
The what man?
(surprised) The fat man.
Well, Freud was right. So you think  they came for the fag man, huh? And  what do you base this upon?
He was the only one done right. Two  in the back of the head.
And the pennies?
New hitman wants to leave his mark

That's a possibility. Y'know you  Boston cops are perking up. That's  two sound theories in one day, neither  of which deal with abnormally sized  men.  (pause) Another possibility is that they  were placed there with religious  intent.
Yeah. Some cultures still put pennies  in the eyes of the dead, or silver.
The Greeks. The Italians.
The Sicilians.
What's the symbology there?
Smecker tosses the Idiot glance to Dolly.

Symbology? Well, now that Duffy has  relinquished his King Bone Head crown  I see we have an heir to the throne.  I'm sure the word you were looking  for was symbolism. What's the  symbolism there? Let me explain it  to you. In Greek and Roman mythology  when you died you would have to pay  the toll to Charon, the boatman who  ferried you across to the gates of  judgment. This made sure the dead  came to atone for what they did during  their lives, Detective...
Smecker looks at his I.D.
Dollapoppaskalious.
The detectives are impressed.
Holy shit. You're the first one that's  ever got that.
(aside) Yeah, well... I'm an expert in name- ology.
The detectives chuckle.

head_text.subj: INT. PLAZA HOTEL SUITE LIVING ROOM NIGHT

text: Smecker is chain smoking. His clothes appear unkempt. His eyes show emotion at every new found clue. The detectives watch closely. He is hunched over the body of the fat man probing his wounds with his gloved fingers. Greenly has r entered. He defiantly holds a cup of coffee but is too  intimidated to interrupt Smecker. He sets it down and fol his arms.
I've seen burns like these before.  They used silencers. Look at these  entry and exit wounds. They're  identical.
He stands up and gives a lesson to the now eager detectiv He points his two index fingers to the back of his own sk
The two bullets went in here, through  the top of the skull, criss-crossed  and exited through the eyeballs.  This one clue tells us three distinct  facts. Number one... Duffy.
They shot him at a downward angle. (makes connection) They put him on his knees.
Excellent! Number two. Greenly.
Uh.  (thinking hard) Shit, I, uh...

It tells us that he was the last to  die. All these men  (fans across the  corpses with his  hand) Were carrying. They came in, dropped  all in seconds and then took their  time with fag man. Didn't they,  Duffy?! (psychotic laugh) They sure as fuck did!
A wide-eyed Duffy joins with Smecker, by nodding his head Smecker is seducing all of them.
And number three, Dolly.
Uh... two shooters!
Fan-fuckin-tastic!
Greenly and Duffy want to know how.

Now stay with me, boys. What did  they do to make two such identical  wounds? Did one guy put him on his  knees, pop a cap in, sit him back up  and shoot him again the same way?  No. Two men of similar height dropped  this guy down, each put some iron to  his head and boom! That's all she  fuckin' wrote!
What about one guy with two guns?

Possible, but unlikely. The angles  are too extreme. A guy holding two  guns to the back of your head is  gonna shoot straight ahead. He  wouldn't cock out his elbows, makes  no sense. Besides, you telling me  one guy came in here and killed eight  men with eight extremely well aimed  shots in just a few seconds? No way.  Had to be at least two.

head_text.subj: INT. PLAZA HOTEL SUITE LIVING ROOM NIGHT LATER

text: Smecker is now a complete mess. His hair is totally frazz He is sucking on cigarettes long and hard. His clothes ar completely disheveled.
Television,... television is the  explanation for this.
Smecker points toward the ceiling revealing a huge gaping hole in it just above the living room.

You see this is bad television. (again pointing out  the hole in the  ceiling) The little assault guys creeping in  through the vents and coming in  through the ceilings. That James  Bond shit never happens in real life.  Professionals don't do that. So we've  got this up here, which has novice  written all over it. And all this  down here that's simply a perfect  textbook assassination. So here's  our two possibilities. We either  have rank amateurs that got lucky or  consummate professionals that fucked  up.
The detectives nod in agreement. They are now completely  taken in by Smecker's spell.
Join me in a drink, gentlemen.

They go over and grab seats at the bar. Smecker mixes him a gin and tonic on the other side. He is calming down now and going back into cool mode. He starts to tuck his clot back in and fix his hair. He leans over the bar and sips drink. The three detectives lean in.

With the exception of my coffee boy,  you Boston detectives are starting  to show signs of intelligence. So, I  am going to make you privy to some  information that you would not  normally be. These men are all Russian  mob. Not like those two peons in the  alley the other day. These guys are  all syndicate bosses and underbosses.  I have a dossier on every man in  this room. Since the Iron Curtain  has gone down, the Russian syndicates  have started to come here. And in  the spirit of Glasnost the Soviets  have opened their borders to the  mafia. But the Italians, they're not  convinced that the grounds in mother  Russia are fertile enough for  organized crime yet. So they ain't  ready to commit. The Russians are  coming here anyway. They are  unwelcome. What we have here,  gentlemen, is possibly the beginning  of the first international mob war...  unless I've totally missed something.
All their faces read the gravity of the situation.
Now, what is this going to look like  to those who do not know what I just  told you?
It's gonna look like the bad guys  are killing each other.

And is there an American, shit is  there a man seated among us that  hasn't thought about it many times,  let's just put them all on an island,  give them guns and let them kill  each other. This is our wet dream  come true. You can expect federal  and local law enforcement to go only  deep enough to satisfy the law, then  bury it from here on out.
So, what do we do now?
That depends. You either do your job  or get ethical.

head_text.subj: INT. ROCCO'S APARTMENT NIGHT

text: Rocco comes out of the bathroom. He storms out to his sma round, living room table at which the boys are seated. He wearing a white, polyester shirt with gold trim that is a uniform of some kind for perhaps a chain of restaurants. is unbuttoned all the way down and his white t-shirt is  hanging out. He is wearing a name tag that reads "Jaffar" He is upset. He slams down a chair across from the brothe who are sitting there cleaning guns and silencers. All th accouterments of death are sprawled before them. They are smoking as they carefully disassemble their firearms.
This better be good.  (viciously ties his  hair back) Talk!
The boys look at each other.

head_text.subj: EXT. SIDEWALK DOWNTOWN BOSTON NIGHT

text: The boys are walking across Copley Square. Connor looks a the note he wrote at the police station. They stand on th sidewalk and light smokes. They are in their regular garb thick naval P-coats, jeans and leather boots. They each c a mid-sized, black, duffle bag. They are serious and busi like. They scan the Plaza Hotel from across the street. T elite exit and enter the hotel. Connor glances at his poc watch. It's 8:45.

head_text.subj: INT. PLAZA HOTEL ELEVATOR NIGHT

text: They enter. They look ahead, stone-faced, as the elevator climbs.
Nervous?
A bit.
Me, too.

The elevator stops at the lobby level. Nine, well-dressed men enter. Their faces are not shown. The boys move to th back wall. One guy says something quickly to another in Russian. The other gives a one word Russian response. They boys look a each other. As the elevator climbs, their eyes focus. The door opens. As the men exit the elevator, each face i seen individually, all are victims from Smecker's crime s The elevator goes up half a floor. They hit the stop butt and rummage in their bags. They suit up; black gloves and black masks. They strap on four 9mm. pistols with silence in shoulder holsters, one under each arm. Connor takes a  large coil of black rope and drapes it around himself. He looks at Murphy and at the rope in his bag. Murphy is too excited to argue.
You and your fucking rope.
He puts it on. They drop to their knees, making the sign the cross. Then, up through the ceiling they go.

head_text.subj: INT. PLAZA HOTEL ELEVATOR SHAFT NIGHT

text: They stand on top of the elevator before a long air shaft
(smiling) See. I told you there'd be a shaft.
(smiling) Just like on TV.
They jump into the air shaft.

head_text.subj: INT. PLAZA HOTEL AIR SHAFT NIGHT

text: They start crawling with Connor in front and Murphy behin

head_text.subj: INT. PLAZA HOTEL SUITE NIGHT

text: The plump boss is standing in the middle of the sunken li room. His eight Russian comrades are around him seated on the U shaped pit couch. They speak Russian, but no subtitles ar seen. The fat man yells. He's mad about something.

head_text.subj: INT. PLAZA HOTEL AIR SHAFT NIGHT

text: Connor is taking lots of random turns, left and right. He starting to look a bit confused.

head_text.subj: INT. PLAZA HOTEL SUITE NIGHT

text: The fat man is really yelling at them now. He is screamin and pointing at each man. They seem to be taking it seriously.

head_text.subj: INT. PLAZA HOTEL AIR SHAFT NIGHT

text: Their brows are drenched with sweat. Murphy crawls up nex to Connor. There is only enough room for the two to lie o their sides facing each other.
Where the fuck are you going?
We'll find it. Just calm down.
No, fuck you. This rope is bullshit.  I'm sweatin' my ass off draggin'  this stupid thing around. Must weigh  30 pounds.
Murphy takes off the rope.
We're doing some serious shit here.  Now, get a hold of yourself, asshole.
Asshole!? I'm not the rope-totin'  Charlie Bronson wanna-be that's  getting' us lost!
Sh, sh! Fuck you!
Connor grabs Murphy's shirt.
No, fuck you!

The boys get into a close quarters battle. An occasional  insult is thrown as feet kick and fists fly. They begin t get tangled in their own rope. The seam of the duct break and a tangled mess of rope and MacManuses pour out.

head_text.subj: INT. PLAZA HOTEL SUITE NIGHT

text: They crash through the ceiling right above the fat man's  head. The rope gets caught and slams the boys to a halt,  hanging them upside down, back to back about six feet abo the floor. They are turning in circles. The boss is balle up in the fetal position on the floor. The shocked Russia say only a word or two in panic before the MacManus broth react, reaching for their guns. The Russians start to rea for their guns. It's too late. The boys draw and fire as  they spin. Taking four shots apiece. There are eight dead Russians. Chests explode as they fal back on the couch in a loose circle. One victims is blast over the couch. They notice the fat man directly beneath them. Murphy gra his Rambo knife, reaches up and cuts the rope. They land a heap, scramble over to the doomed man and place him on knees. They each put a gun to the back of his head and re this prayer in perfect unison.

And shepherds we shall be. For thee,  my Lord, for thee. Power hath  descended forth from thy hand that  our feet may swiftly carry out thy  command. So we shall flow a river  forth to thee and teeming with souls  shall it ever be. E nomini patri, et  Fili e spiritu sancti.

With the silenced pop from their guns we cut the sound an go to black and white. (Slo-mo) Choral music starts with  Latin script being read in the background. They take thei rosaries out. They slowly walk around, mumbling prayers a they care for the dead. They gently turn over the bodies  that were on their stomachs. They brush the hair back fro the victims faces. They place pennies in the eyes of al t corpses. When they finish their ritual, they pull off the masks and look at each other. They start to grin and look around. They work each other into a healthy chuckle.
(looks up) That was some good fuckin' rope.
They both laugh.
That was way easier than I thought.
Aye.
On TV ya always get that asshole  that jumps behind the couch.
Yeah, and ya gotta shoot at him for  ten minutes.
Oh, we're good man.
Yes, we are.
They are already striding for a suitcase full of money. Murphy picks up a wad of bills.
I love our new job.

Just then, there's a knock at the door. They snap into ac They stand at each side of the double doors, looking thro the peepholes. They see Rocco on the other side dressed a hotel employee. He wears a polyester shirt with gold trim and a name tag that reads Jaffar. He has a good cart in f of him. They look at each other and grin. Murphy nods. As they op the door, Murphy grabs the food cart and pulls it in. Connor seizes the mortified Rocco and pulls him in, slamm the door shut behind him. They run, dragging him and then throw him in the midst of the bodies. They put their guns right in his face.
Oh, God! Don't kill me! We're on the  same side! The boss musta sent you  in as back up, huh? Oh, shit, please!  I'm Rocco. I'm the funny man. (almost crying) They call me the funny fuckin' man!
(attempting to hide  accent) Where's your gun?
Chest pocket.  (they take it) Shit!
This is a six-shooter.
(hiding accent) Nine bodies.
Oh, you're good. What were you gonna  do? Laugh the last three to death,  funny man?
Poppa Joe said there was only two.  In and out. (trying to make friends) Boy, you guys sure did a good job.  You're good, huh? Cool masks. Where'd  you get them?
Let's do him right here.
Right now.
(screaming like a  baby) Don't kill me. Oh shit, please no.  I'm Rocco. I'm the funny man!... the  funny man... the funny.
The boys put their faces close to his and demask. They st laughing but Rocco just lays there, wide-eyed, in shock. They boys saunter to the bar. Rocco takes a long beat.
What did you do?! Fuckin'... what  the fuckin' fuck! Who the fuck, fucked  this fuckin'? fuck. How did you two  fuckin', fucks?......... FUCK!!!
Certainly illustrates the diversity  of the word.
The brothers laugh.
What the fuck are you doing here?  What, huh!? WHAT? WHAT? WHAT? ANSWERS!  I WANT FUCKIN' ANSWERS!
(slaps his face) Get a hold of yourself, man.
Rocco is silent and surprised. Murphy, also surprised, lo at Rocco. All is quiet.
Yeah, get a hold of yourself.
Murphy jokingly slaps Rocco a second time. Rocco instantl jumps on Murphy, cursing and punching. The brothers burst into laughter as they subdue Rocco. As he calms down, the release him.
Listen, we gotta get outta here now.  We'll take separate exits and meet  at Rocco's.
Murphy puts the two suitcases in his duffle bag and the t brush by Rocco who is still unsatisfied with his explanat
Fuck!

head_text.subj: BACK TO PRESENT INT. ROCCO'S APARTMENT NIGHT

text: Rocco has removed his hotel jacket.
Anybody you think is evil?
Yes.
Don't you think that's a little  psycho? A little weird?

Weird, huh?... Know what I think is  weird? Decent men with loving families  go home every day after work. They  turn on the news and see rapists,  murderers, and child molesters all  getting out of prison.
Mafiosos getting caught with 20 kilos  and walkin' on bail the same day.
Little girls catchin' stray bullets  in their heads, playin' hopscotch in  their front yards. And everyone thinks  the same thing... Someone should  just go kill those motherfuckers.
Kill em all. Admit it, even you've  thought about it.
Rocco ponders this as the boys continue to clean their  weapons.
You guys should be in every major  city.
The boys chuckle. Rocco steadily works himself into a hum frenzy.

This is some heavy shit. This is  like Lone Ranger-heavy man. Fuck it!  There's so much shit that pisses me  off. You guys should recruit 'cause  I am sick and fuckin' tired of walkin'  down the street waitin' for one of  these assholes to get me, y'know?
(chuckling) Hallelujah, Jaffar.
So you're not just talkin' mob guys.  You're talkin' anyone, right? Even  like pimps and drug dealers and all  that shit?
The boys look at each other and nod.
Well fuck, you guys could do this  every day.
We're like 7-Eleven. We ain't always  doing business, but we're always  open.
Nicely put.

head_text.subj: INT. ROCCO'S APARTMENT NIGHT ONE HOUR LATER

text: The three are partying hard. There's a pizza surrounded b Guinness cans as they whoop it up, sitting at the round t Rocco wears one of the masks. They're all drunk. The hous cat is lounging on the table comfortably.
You fuckin' guys. You ruined me. I'm  fuckin' done. Permanent package boy.
Who says that? You could take credit  on it.
What are you serious?
Yeah, fuck it. If you think about  it, it's all you can do really. You  can't tell him it was us. Go in  braggin' and shit.
Climb the corporate ladder, boy. Don  Rocco.
Fuck it! I'm doing it. I deserve it.  I've been working for those fat  bastards since I was in high school  and look at this place.
The boys nod in agreement.

(working into a frenzy) They're fuckin' me man! Hey, they  can suck my pathetic little dick.  And I'll dip my nuts in marinara  just so the fat fucks can get a taste  of home while they're at it. That's  it, it's done, I'm doing it.

Rocco slams his fist down on the table next to Murphy's g The gun goes off with a bang! and blows the lounging cat  right off the table. A softball-sized hole is blasted in wall as a large splatter of blood sprays the area surroun the hole. Everyone is in shock for a second.
I can't fuckin' believe that just  happened!

The three are passed out all over the apartment. Rocco  awakens. He stumbles past the wall with the large, round, pink stain on it. There is a crooked picture hanging in t middle of it. Rocco staggers to the kitchen and throws water in his fac over a sinkful of dirty dishes. Connor awakens, grabs his jacket and follows Rocco out.
(hung over) Donna's gonna be angry about her  cat.
Shit. She's on every drug know to  man. She'd have sold that thing for  a dime bag. Screw her.  (beat) But I do kinda feel like an ass-hole.
(chuckles) You sound real remorseful.
Connor lights up two smokes and hands one to Rocco.
She ain't been around in weeks anyhow.
(beat) Listen. Something's been bothering  me about last night.
What?
Well... what if your boss knew how  many guys were supposed to be there...  in that room?
What are you saying?
Think about it man. Nine men, six  bullets.
You think they sold me out? No way.

He probably knew you'd end up nailing  the fat guy, maybe one or two more,  but he had to know you weren't walking  out of there. Figure it out. Shooter's  dead on the scene. No in-depth  investigation. It'd slide right off  his back. 'Cause as much as I love  ya, you're not exactly Don Corleone.  What would he be losing? A thirty- five year old delivery boy?
No, no. That's just not the way things  are done. Besides, how's he know I  don't just get in there see there's  too many and just serve em their  fuckin' food and beat it?

He knows you, man. He knows all you  want is to move up. That's all. A  smooth hitter woulda gone in there,  seen it was a wash and slipped out.  But a guy like you? Knowin' this is  your only chance? Waitin' eighteen  years?
No. No man. That's... that's... you  don't know what you're talking about.  That's bullshit. I know these guys.  I mean, thanks for your concern, but  that just ain't the thing of it.
Do me a favor and roll it around for  a bit on your way in.
No, look. No rolling. Nothing needs  to be rolled.
Murphy stumbles enters scene with Rocco and Connor.
(to Rocco) Where are you goin'? (to Connor) Did you tell him?
Yes.
(to Rocco) Then what the fuck?
Hey. You don't know that shit for  sure.
Oh, Jesus. You're such a fuckin'  retard!
Fuck you!
Use your brain for once. Is it so  unbelievable they don't care about  you? You are fuckin' dead, you go in  there today. Dead!
Oh yeah. You two fuckin' Micks know  what's going on, huh? (flips them off) Fuck you!
(trying to calm him) Hey, this ain't a thing you should  gamble on, Roc.
A girl rides by on a bicycle, they pause as she rides bet them.
Fuck it! What kind of flowers ya  want at your funeral? Ya dumb Wop.  This is the last time I'll see you.  Bye-bye ya stupid son of a bitch.
(walking away) I'll be back at 9:00.
Hey. You get in there and start  getting a bad vibe, get the fuck out  quick.

head_text.subj: INT. ROCCO'S APARTMENT LATE AFTERNOON

text: Connor picks up the place as Murphy watches t.v. The phon rings.
Hello?
Hey Murph.
Roc. You okay?
Yeah. Anybody call for me?
No. You sure you're okay?
I'm fuckin' fine. (beat) Catch you on the flip side.
Rocco hangs up. Just then DONNA and her friend RAYVIE ent the apartment. They are consummate junky sluts who are ve doped up and giddy.
(trying hard) Here kitty, kitty...... kitty.

head_text.subj: INT. SIN BIN SMALL ROOM NIGHT

text: Smecker ascends the three, small steps up to the round ro A NUDE DANCER sits there on the couch in a robe. She is c as she is being consoled by Detective Duffy. This small r is where men watch girls through a large glass window. In this room a dancer performs on a floor a few feet abov the three private booths where each man watches from his booth. She appears as if on stage. All three windows are  shattered and there is blood on the wall of all three boo We see assorted body parts in each booth, but no faces.
(approaches Smecker) She was in here when it went down.
Can she I.D. them?
They were wearing masks.
Of course they were. How many?
Three.
Smecker looks at Dolly surprised.
Only two did the shooting. (beat) So what are you thinking, Russian  retaliation?

Nah, too quick half their  infrastructure got taken out at the  Copley plaza. Besides, if you're a  hitter, you're either working for  the Russians or the Italians. There's  no riding the fence. Our little theory  from last night just got blown to  shit. Something... new is going on  here.
Smecker sits next to the girl. He has Compassion. She Cri
Probably shouldn't work another shift  for awhile.
Fuck this job. I'm getting out of  the porno business and I don't care  who I gotta blow to do it.

head_text.subj: INT. SIN BIN SMALL ROOM NIGHT

text: The bodies have been removed and chalk outlines replace t The bullet holes in the walls have been marked either A o B. The detectives watch Smecker. He is a mess. His clothe are disheveled and his hair is frazzled.
After talking to the dancer we know  that their mark was the guy in the  middle booth. After she watches them  whack him, she passes out. (pause) Why the two extra victims?
Witness?
No way they could have seen it.

Smecker hits an orange button on the wall and a black ste door with a money slot comes slamming down in front of th first booth. He does the same thing to the last booth, le the middle one open. Both doors possess peep holes.

(sarcastic) Allow me to enlighten you gentlemen  to the protocol of the porno industry,  as I'm sure you've never been in one  of these places before. A man goes  into the booth, puts the money in  the slot. The dancer gets it on the  other side. She hits the button,  door goes up, now there is only glass  between you and it's (makes a masturbatory  gesture with hand) little fireman time.
No way they could have seen it?
Those doors were down... which means  this. They looked down in through  the peep hole, saw these guys and  opened the doors from the inside.  Pop, pop, pop, right through the  glass. Why?
Maybe the three of them had something  in common.
No. This guy is big time. (points to middle  booth) These two are street-walking scum.
(kidding) Then that's what they had in common.  They were all bad guys... now they're  all dead bad guys.
Smecker seems side-tracked and ponderous at Greenly's  observation. He hits the orange buttons and raises the do

We got another thing to think about  here. We got us a genuine Kennedy  assassination style bullet theory.  Two guns were used here, guns A and  B. The guy in the middle was done  with both. But this guy... (denotes right booth) ...he was killed with bullets from  gun A only. And this guy... (denotes left booth) ...gun B only. But ballistics dug  two slugs out of the wall from over  here where the victim was done with  A.
Smecker points to two bullet holes in the wall of the boo on the left. Each is marked "B". He walks over to the rig booth where in the exact location are two identical holes marked "A".
And it's the same story over here.  Why the crossover? (beat) Theories.
That's just fucking weird. I have no  idea.
