Jesus. I just can't think anymore.  That scene over at the coffee shop  today tapped me out.
What?
A guy went nuts over off of  Commonwealth today. Shot three guys  to death in a coffee shop in broad  daylight. Fled the scene. Don't have  much on him.
(angry) Why was I not informed of this?
They weren't related. The guy used a  38. No pennies. Totally amateur.
Who were the victims?
A couple of peons for the mob and...

(livid) Oh that's just BEAUTIFUL! All the  scumbags in the quiet city of Boston  start dropping dead and you think  it's unrelated?! Greenly, the day I  want the Boston Police doing my  thinking for me, I will have a fucking  tag on my toe! Now, get me a squad  car and get me over there. I want  the crime scene photos and any witness  statements. NOW!

Smecker storms from the room. The detectives begin to fol Smecker comes barreling back in, shoving them out of the  way. He looks at the bullet holes in the walls marked "A B" again. Something has clicked.
(wide-eyed) Oh... it looks like we got us a  cowboy.

head_text.subj: INT. LAKEVIEW LUNCH NIGHT

text: Smecker surveys photos and papers, as he smokes profusely He stands next to a table in the back where chairs are kn over. Body chalk and blood stains are everywhere. The  detectives seem like they don't want to be there, again.
The shooter knew these guys, huh?
How do you figure?
Friends, Gentlemen. They were friends.
Smecker flashes them a photo of a dead body. The victim i shot in the head and face down in his plate of food. His  hands are on the table in front of him.

These guys were packing. Not one  hand near a gun. It's simple human  behavior. Someone you don't know  approaches you, you put your hand on  it. This guy's got his hands on the  table. He's eating his food, for  Christ sakes. They were friends.
Smecker looks over the bar.
These two fucking scenes are related.  Too many coincidences. Same day?  Five hours apart? Dead mobsters on  both scenes. Now, why did he kill  the bartender?
Crime of passion. He just went nuts.  He would have shot everyone in here.  He just ran out of bullets.

Duffy. This look like a fucking post  office to you? This guy came in here  with intent. Maybe he didn't know  exactly what he was gonna do but he  had a pretty good idea. The bartender  wasn't a fucking accident.
Well, we didn't get any help on that.  A lot of people saw it. Nobody's  talking.

Fucking figures. Look, are you guys  seeing the pattern here? We got big  questions at both of these crime  scenes, with no answers. WHY did  they kill the guys in the other two  booths? WHY did he do the bartender?  It would seem unnecessary, even  stupid. (angry) God, I hate cold crime scenes! I'm  fucking leaving now. And do me a  favor, tell me when the next guy  dies, cause these guys are not done  yet.
He storms to the entry way.

head_text.subj: INT. LAKEVIEW LUNCH ENTRY WAY NIGHT

text: Smecker walks across the street, still angry, and goes to payphone. There's an extreme close-up on his hand as he p in a quarter. As the quarter jingles in...

head_text.subj: EXT. STREET IN FRONT OF LAKEVIEW LUNCH DAY

text: ...there is a close-up on a hand pulling back from the co slot. The hand moves up to pull a cigarette from its  possessor's mouth. It is Rocco. He dials the phone.
Hello?
Hey, Murph.
Roc. You okay?
Yeah. Anybody call for me?
No. You sure you're okay?
I'm fuckin' fine. (beat) Catch you on the flip side.
He goes across the street and enters Salamone's.

head_text.subj: INT. ROCCO'S APARTMENT DAY

text: Donna and Rayvie are laying on the couch. Connor is spit- shining his boots by the window. Murphy lights his cigare on the gas stove and pours some salt in a pot of water wi a handful of pennies boiling to a shine in it. Rocco burs through the door, hysterical. Tears are streaming down hi face.
Pack your shit! We gotta get outta  here! We gotta get out!
(hopping into his  boots) What happened?
I killed em! Oh, Jesus! I killed em  all!!
Rocco?
Hey, hey. Just calm down. Tell us  what happened!
No! Fuck you! You start getting  excited! We gotta fucking go!
Rocco!
(packing up gear) Who did you kill?
(packing up gear) Holy shit. Who? How many?
(rummaging through  his drawers) Hurry the fuck up!
This is some crazy shit, man!
Those cocksuckers sold me out!
Did I fuckin' tell ya, Rocco? They  pull on you first?
ROCCO!
What did I fuckin' do?... in the  middle of the Lakeview.
Lakeview the deli? Oh, shit!
Ha! Ha! Roc, you got a jumbo set of  coconut balls man!
ROCCO!
(turns in rage) What?
(softly) Where's my cat?
(slight pause) I killed your fuckin' cat, you druggie  bitch!
(shocked, hurt) You... oh god, why?
I felt it would bring closure to our  relationship!

My, my...

It was... It was...

Wyatt-fuckin'-Earp, man!

text: An old man appears to look at himself in the mirror of an empty but very upper class bathroom. His eyes are very gl over. He puts a large leather case on the counter near th sinks. A red and white blind stick hangs off his right  forearm. Yakavetta enters, crosses behind him and stands next to h AUGUSTUS (72 years) sniffs the air. Fuck you.
Hey, Augustus, I need your help, I  got a serious problem here. I'm not  screwing around.

Augustus begins to remove items from his suitcase. First plate. He sets it down next to the sink. Then assorted  colognes, cigarettes and chewing gum. He begins arranging them in neat rows, always feeling with his guiding hands.
Hey, I just...

Don't start with your shit. Don't  you talk to me. Oh, hey Uncle Gussy,  thanks for years of service. Here's  a gold watch and a job sniffing other  guys' shit eight hours a day. What  am I, a retired bus driver?

Your dad and I used him three times  over twenty years, only when  everything went totally fucked.  Believe me kid, you don't want this  guy unless you are 100% sure you  need him. He is... a fuckin' monster.

This is so fuckin' cool!

Now, they know the wife is the gate  keeper. She knows the code.

text: They walk with the terrified woman around the pool to a s door pool house entrance. There is a number pad next to t door. Rocco positions her in front of it.

Now the guy knows a friend is coming  to the game. And they know that this  door can only be opened from the  inside. So they wait... and when  that door opens, man...
The knob turns and they kick it in.

They burst in and line up shoulder to shoulder, guns aime Smecker stands beside Rocco with his thumb and forefinger extended to mimic guns. Five mafiosos sit around a poker  table in front of time. Two men are playing pool to their left. Rocco quickly scans the room.
All of them.
They begin firing. Men are dying, their chests exploding. Smecker moves his hands like firing guns and yells over t noise.
Nobody was ready for it. Devastation,  panic! This was like shooting fish  in a fuckin' barrel!
Smecker points to the pool table as the two players dive  under it.
Now these guys dove under the table.  The trajectory on the bullets show  they came from straight across. So  this means one of our shooters...  dropped to his knees...

Smecker drops to his knees in perfect synchronicity with  Rocco. They are side by side and leaning back. Rocco fires and the men under the table skip around as th are riddled with bullets. Smecker's mimicking hands follo him perfectly with each shot. The boys and Rocco demask. Rocco goes around to all the bodies and looks earnestly a each one, as Connor and Murphy pick up bullet casings.
Shit!... Shit! He ain't here.

Look again for fuck sake!

Something went wrong. Right here.

But as soon as the man sees his ha bam! he comes down on it with the towel rack. Rocco pulls back in pain dropping his other gun but the gun fires, as the man's blow connects. Let the boy go!
He is now being choked, as he glares at them in disbelief
C'mon Roc!
Now, one of these guys is a real  sicko. He knew this man. He wanted  him to suffer, to feel every second  of a painful death.
As Rocco is wrestling and punching on the floor. He looks up.
Help me you assholes!  (they continue to  cheer) He's gonna fuckin' kill me! (he fights harder)
This guy is one bad motherfucker.
I don't wanna die!!!!!

Murphy is aching to help but Connor is more steady. A man who has been shot starts to regain consciousness. Connor  turns his back to shoot him (slo-mo). Murphy sees his  opportunity, pulls the cue ball from the table, and rolls silently across the carpet toward Rocco. Connor fires with his left hand and as the casing ejects  from the gun he catches it in mid air and makes the sign the cross. Rocco is on his back, the man is straddling hi They both have each others throats and are trying to stra one another. When the ball is within arms reach, Rocco sl his hand down on it and knocks his assailant in the skull He straddles him and begins to mercilessly beat his face with the cue ball, yelling "You sick fuck!" He finally stops, gets up, runs toward the boys, and thro an exhausted punch at Connor who just lays Roc down on th pool table and says, "Nicely done, boy". Murphy tends to  Roc. Connor checks out the man and seems surprised. Murphy takes the bloody cue ball from Rocco's hand and  polishes it off on his jacket, making sure Connor cannot  see. He replaces it perfectly on the table. Smecker now s in front of the table with the cue shining in the backgro
I've never seen wounds like these  before, but whatever he used on this  guy, it was a blunt object and they  took it with them.

Smecker exits to the left as Greenly enters from the righ following Smecker out. He walks by the table furiously  scribbling in his notebook. Rocco holds two duffle bags full of poker mon Greenly stops, picks up the cue ball and looks at the dea man. He shakes his head and says, "Nah".

location: SUBURBAN "BEAVER CLEAVER" TYPE HOUSE FRONT LAWN D

text: Smecker stands in the middle of the front lawn. His hair a mess. He's chain-smoking. His clothes are disheveled. His eyes are psychotic. He points to the parked Taurus as six men in dark suits appear in a fuzzy, out-of-focus sho They line up shoulder to shoulder on the sidewalk.
They exited out the front door. And  they had no fucking idea what they  were in for.

text: Rocco, Connor and Murphy walk toward the front door.

text: (Slo-mo) Two black leather boots slowly walk up the sidew and stop in front of the new, gray Ford Taurus then turn  toward the house. Il Duce removes a white balloon filled  with a few ounces of fluid from the pocket of his black t coat. He throws it on the walk, the blood splatters. location: SUBURBAN "BEAVER CLEAVER" TYPE HOUSE FRONT STOOP

text: The boys come out, Rocco in the middle and slightly ahead them. They look out to the walk, stunned.
Now they are staring at six guys  with guns drawn. It was a fucking  ambush.

Our three heroes stand, their jaws dropping as their poin of view reveals the Il Duce, standing alone, his hands fo in front of him. Suddenly, he throws open his trench coat to reveal a spec leather vest beneath. Six guns, all different, are holste on the front of it: three on each side extend from just b his collar bones to his abdomen. Connor and Murphy don't  hesitate. They each draw one of their now unsilenced guns from their shoulder holsters and aim, one arm over each o Rocco's shoulders. The Duke draws his top two weapons and aims.
And this was a fucking bomb dropping  in Beaver Cleaverville! For a few  seconds this place was Armageddon!  There was a fire fight!

They all start shooting at once. The noise is deafening. The Taurus is being pierced and the front of the house is splintering as it is riddled with bullets. Smecker is sti in the middle, hands raised to the heavens, turning circl Rocco's pinky finger gets shot off, sending blood splatte against the house. He dives in the bushes reeling. Il Duce with lightening speed, drops the guns an pulls the next two down as he walks to his right about te feet. He commences firing and the casings hit the sidewal all different calibers and sizes are dropping down the wa It's him and Connor and nobody is backing down. They both grind their teeth as they fire rapidly at each other. At same moment, The Duke gets hit in the arm and Connor take bullet in the leg. The firing ceases for a moment. Connor remains steady and Il Duce looks down at his arm a his own blood splattered on the sidewalk.
No!... No! No!...

He drops the guns and pulls the last two as he moves to t right. He fires with wrath as he screams the word No over and over. The Duke turns and runs, leaving a sea of casings, and gu that extend for 35 feet down the walk. There are also two blood stains. In a frenzy the boys and Rocco get up and withdraw some s bottles from their bags. The begin spraying all their own blood stains on the stoop and the front of the white hous They then pick up their things and run off.

location: SUBURBAN "BEAVER CLEAVER" TYPE HOUSE FRONT LAWN DA

text: Smecker comes back to reality and lights a cigarette in f of Dolly, Duffy, and Greenly.
What if it was just one guy with six  guns?
Why don't you let me do the thinking,  huh, genius?
He turns to the forensics guys at the front of the house begins to walk over to him.
What is taking so long with those  blood samples?
I can't get a good sample. There is  variable here I'm not seeing.
Smecker puts his finger through a big blood stain on the  door and smells it.
(in shock, and rage) They used ammonia... none of this  shit is any good... Fuck... You know  what this means?! Even if we get  suspects in this case, we got  nothing... Nothing!
He starts kicking the bushes and trying to tear them with his hands as he rages. The police and forensics all back  off.
(screaming) Who the fuck are they?! I've never  seen any-fucking-thing like this in  my whole fucking life. Who the fuck  are they?!!

He backs against the building and slides down to a sittin position in the bushes as if he has given up. He raises h head and there he sees Rocco's pinky finger lying undisco in the bushes. He pulls a small plastic bag from his pock and scoops it up. He shoves it back into his pocket and r off.
What? That's it?!

head_text.subj: INT. ROCCO'S MOM'S KITCHEN NIGHT

text: Rocco, Connor, and Murphy are sitting around the table. They are numb with pain and silently sipping beers. Sudde Smecker comes on the news making an announcement that he heading up the investigation to find the three of them. Rocco shuts it off.
Shit.
What? (points to TV) What, that guy?
That's the guy that got us off the  hook with the "Checkov" thing.
And he is one smart man.
They got nothing.
This guy is very sharp. If he hasn't  figured us out yet, he will.
You bet your ass he will.
Well, I'd say that makes him a lia- fuckin-bility.
The boys look at each other.
He isn't to be touched.
He's a good man.
Okay... whatever. (looking at the bloody  mess) My Mom's gonna kill me.

text: Smecker is sitting at a computer terminal. He has just ho into the F.B.I.'s computer network with his authorization code. No. This is all wrong. David Della  Rocco?
Rocco on the steps of the police station when Rocco broug the boys their clothes.

Boston Police Department.

Okay, thank you.
He hangs us, puts in a smoke, and knocks his head back in deep thought.

head_text.subj: INT. GAY BAR NIGHT

text: Smecker is drinking like a fiend. He is disturbed and row He's a bad drunk. He downs a shot and motions for another one. The BARTENDER comes over.

Pour the drink, faggot-ass!
He obeys. A good looking gay man comes up and whispers in Smecker's ear and points to the back room.
Okay... But I don't cuddle.
They proceed to the back. Smecker is stumbling.

Hey! We gotta talk about this early  morning church shit.
We have to go now. (giggles) We're on the lamb.

head_text.subj: EXT. STREET IN FRONT OF THE GAY BAR EARLY MORNING

text: Smecker staggers out of the bar. He is an absolute wreck. Rocco exits a package store just down the street. He is  opening a new pack of cigarettes. He is surprised when he sees Smecker at the other end of the block. He follows th stumbling agent, fumbling for his gun.

head_text.subj: EXT. STREET IN FRONT OF CHURCH EARLY MORNING

text: Paul sees a church and reflects for a moment before cross the street and going in, Rocco a safe distance behind.

head_text.subj: INT. CHURCH EARLY MORNING

text: Connor and Murphy are at prayer in the back of the church It is mostly empty because of the early hour. Connor looks up and sees Smecker and Rocco way up in the  front. His eyes are ablaze. He is up and walking and does not bother Murphy, who remains penitent. There are two  confessional booths with a priest booth in the middle. Smecker goes in the booth on the far left. Rocco tries th door, it's locked. A middle-aged PRIEST slips a key in th priests booth and opens the door. Rocco shoves him in and goes in behind him. Connor has quickened his pace. He tri both doors. They're locked. He goes into the confessional the right.

head_text.subj: INT. CHURCH PRIEST'S BOOTH EARLY MORNING

text: Rocco puts his gun to the priest's head.
You gonna do what I say, got it?
Yes.
I'm sorry you're gonna hafta see  this. Don't look at me!
I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I didn't see.
Shut up! Shut the fuck up!

head_text.subj: INT. CHURCH CONNOR'S CONFESSIONAL EARLY MORNING

text: Connor is furiously working his fingers through the latti work to open the slider to the priest's booth from his si

head_text.subj: INT. CHURCH PRIEST'S BOOTH EARLY MORNING

text: Rocco takes the priest and puts his face in front of the  slider to Smecker's booth, gun to the back of his head.
Don't do this my son.
Open it!
Have you no fear of God?
That's who I'm doing this for, now  open the fuckin' thing.

Connor gets the slider open. Rocco's long hair hangs just inches from Connor's face. Connor puts his thumb and  forefinger through, desperately reaching for a lock of Ro hair. Rocco jostles the priest and puts the gun hard to h head.
Father, I'll do you right here.
(slowly obey,  whispering) God have mercy on my soul.

Rocco starts to move the priest aside and put his gun to  Smecker's now open slider. Just then Connor snags a piece of Rocco's hair and pulls back hard and fast by it, until his head slams into the  lattice work. Rocco grabs the priest back into position. Connor grabs a nice wad of Rocco's hair with his left han so that the side of Rocco's face is now pressed to the  lattice. Connor then puts a gun to Rocco's head.
(hard whisper) You little fuck. Let him go. I'll  drop you right here.
Okay, just calm down. He could hurt  us, brother. He could ruin the whole  thing.
Let him go or I will deliver you,  right now. (pulls hammer back)
You won't do it Connor, you won't.  You love me man.

head_text.subj: INT. CHURCH CONFESSIONAL BOOTHS EARLY MORNING

text: Smecker wakes up from a drunken stupor. He looks through slider window at the barely discernible face of the now c priest.
(slurred, loud) Hello? You there?
Y-Yes my son.
(whispers) Do your thing Father. Don't fuck  this up.
(whispering to Rocco) What do you want me to say?
Just be natural, goddamit.
How long since your last confession,  my son?
Oh, Christ, uh, I've never confessed.
The priest can hear Connor and Rocco whisper, but Smecker cannot.
According to the dogma of the Catholic  church, I should probably burst into  flames right here in this booth. But  I've come here for advice, not  salvation.
Connor and Rocco stop and listen now.
Why have you come to a church for  council if you're not religious?
(ponderous) Why have I come to a church? I never  have before. I guess I just... felt  I should.
What is it my son?

It's ethics. I put evil men behind  bars, but the law has miles of red  tape and loopholes for these...  cocksuckers to slip through. I've  found out there are these two young  men who fix the situation with an  iron fist. As if they have God's  permission. But what they do is wrong  and I should arrest them...  technically.
God's permission? God doesn't...
Rocco shakes the priest.
But in this day and age I believe  what they do is... necessary. I feel  it is... correct.
You believe?
Yes.
You feel?
Yes.

You feel? A soul is what gives you  feelings. Happiness, guilt, right or  wrong. It is a conduit through which  the Lord speaks to us. You felt that  your answers would be here in the  house of God today. You feel these  men are necessary. The Lord has spoken  to you twice this day.
Rocco and Connor show their individual looks of surprise.
(sarcastically) Has he now?
You have entered the house of the  Lord of your own free will speaking  of beliefs and feelings. Is it so  much to believe that God has brought  you here?
I guess not.
It is easy to be sarcastic about  religion. It is harder to take small  hints from God, your feelings and  listen to them... to take a stand.
The look of surprise on Rocco and Connor's faces show tha the priest is doing a hell of a job.
You're right.
Those who do not act are in a constant  state of ethical indecision.
I want to stand for what I believe  in, father.
Then you must find out what your  beliefs are.
I believe these young men are right.
You know them personally?
Yes.
Do you think they would harm an  innocent man, for any reason?
No. They would never do that.
The priest starts to show signs of anger as he starts tur to Rocco.
Well, the two Irish guys wouldn't.  But the Italian guy, he might. He's  kind of an idiot.
Fear returns to the priests face. Rocco presses the gun h to the priests head and jostles him.
(whispers to priest) Goddam right, I am.

I'm beginning to see. I've been doing  my job... well for fifteen years and  it's just not enough. All the things  I wish I could do, these guys are  doing. Millions of dollars in tax  payers' money wasted on shit like  wire taps and surveillance. Theses  boys go in and take care of it for  the price of a bullet. (looks up) Ww-what do you think I should do?  Because I'm a law man.
Rocco jostles the priest again.
The laws of God are higher than the  laws of man.
(the clouds have lifted) Yes! Yes! I was thinking that, too.  No. I was feeling it. All I needed  was to hear you say it! Amen! I'll  help them.
(whispers) Forgive me father.
Thank you, Father, thank you. (he attempts the sign  of the cross but  screws it up) Whatever. Goodbye, amen.
Smecker exits and they all let go after a brief pause. Ro turns and starts fixing up the priest's ruffled suit.
I wouldn't have, uh, killed you,  Father.  (signs cross) Dominus Ominus. Remember, you're  bound. You can't talk about this...  to anyone.
Just go!

head_text.subj: INT. CHURCH EARLY MORNING

text: Rocco exits the booth and shuts the door behind him. Conn is standing outside, hands on his hips. Rocco smiles at h as Connor fumes.
(giggling) The Lord works in mysterious ways.
Connor slaps him in the back of the head and kicks him in the ass. Rocco's still giggling as they exit.

head_text.subj: INT. PHONE BOOTH UPTOWN LATER

text: That's all you can give me?
We shoot alternating coverage between the two locations.
Well, the light caught the side of  his face for a second. And it looked  like he had a gray beard, maybe...  late fifties, early sixties.
So you're telling me it was one guy  with six guns? A-and he was a senior  fucking citizen?
I think it's better if we find this  man before he finds us again.
I'll see what I can do. How do I get  in touch with you?
We're going to hit Poppa Joe tonight,  right in the comfort of his own home.  Then we move on to New York. It's  getting a bit hot for us here.
Be careful.
I'll call you tonight, afterwards. (hangs up)

head_text.subj: INT. RITZY RESTAURANT BATHROOM NIGHT

text: Smecker stands beside Augustus, just the way Yakavetta di
I don't know who he is. Nobody does.
Smecker tosses an envelope of cash in his plate, just as  Yakavetta did.
What did he bring him in for?
Needed an outsider. The package boy  knows everyone. He'd spot our hitters  a mile away.
Just for him?
Well he's the one shooting up all  his guys, right? He's scared of the  kid. Says he's real good, got every  available gun in the city up there.
Up where?
Up his house. I don't know what's  going on but I know it's gotta have  something to do with this kid.
Oh fuck! (runs out)

head_text.subj: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE BASEMENT HALL NIGHT

text: There are several bodies in the hall, some with pennies i their eyes, some without. Down the dark basement halls th is more gore. The boys and Rocco can be heard screaming f a room in the basement. Yakavetta's voice is heard yellin and in command.

head_text.subj: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE BASEMENT ROOM NIGHT

text: Connor, Murphy, and Rocco are all hand cuffed to chairs i the seated position. Their clothes are ripped and they ha been beaten severely. Blood covers them. Rocco has been  uncuffed and two men hold his open hand up as Yakavetta p a pistol at the base of his remaining pinky finger. Sever other hold him down as he and the boys scream in tough  protest.
(yelling) You gonna tell me what's going on  here?! Huh! You little fuck! Gimme  some answers!

They all yell for him to fuck off. Although Rocco is  terrified, he is holding out. Yakavetta fires and Rocco's finger is gone. The blood splatters on Connor's face. Roc screams in pain saying fuck you through his sobs. After r cuffing Rocco, Yakavetta and his goons exit.

head_text.subj: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE BASEMENT HALL NIGHT

text: Yakavetta is in the hall with four men. GENO (35 yrs.) ve big. CHAPPY (22 yrs.) wears sunglasses even in the dark,  trying to look cool. HOJO (28 yrs.) is slick and good-loo Another Mafioso cohort is with them as well.
What do you guys think?
They're tough. No way they're gonna  talk.
I know Rocco. He ain't smart enough  for this shit. These other guys are  the brains. He's just a player.
There's only one way to get them to  talk.

head_text.subj: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE BASEMENT ROOM NIGHT

text: He walks back into the room. He saunters up to Rocco very nonchalantly and shoots him in the chest. His chair is bl back to the floor. The boys are screaming and crying as  Yakavetta walks out.
(struggles to talk) You guys?
(crying) We're here brother.
You gotta keep going.
(sobbing) We'll keep going, Roc.
You'll make it outta here. You can't  ever stop, not ever.
As Rocco dies, they fall into prayer.

head_text.subj: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE FRONT FOYER NIGHT

text: Yakavetta lights up a cigar and talks to his men.
Once you set him in motion, you can't  call him off. He thinks it's still  on.
Yakavetta stops as if terrified with a thought.
Oh Jesus Christ!
What? I...

Hey, I don't have my name spray  painted on the front of this house.  There are no big pictures of me  anywhere. If this guy thinks the job  is still a go then I got green money  says the mother fucker's out in the  bushes already. I'm fucking gone!  I'm leaving you guys to deal with  this.
The four guys are left alone. They all look far from conf except for Geno.
One fucking guy, so what.
Why don't you take the front. (points) You guys cover those other exits and  if you see him, don't flag him down,  just kill the mother fucker. I'm  going back down to work on these  pricks.

head_text.subj: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE BASEMENT ROOM NIGHT

text: Murphy has scootched his chair in front of Connor's. He h his back to Connor. He stretches his neck over and bites at the collar of his coat. He gathers as much of the material in his mouth as can. He starts to yell, "Do it!" but it is muffled. Connor, still sobbing, begins to kick his brother's left  hand repeatedly. He turns it into a bloody piece of broke meat as Murphy screams through the shirt. Finally, it is  broken enough and Murphy pulls it through the cuff. He stands and breaks the chair into pieces and grabs the  sharpest piece. Hojo enters and Murphy shoves the sharp s up through the bottom of his chin into his head. He drags him around the room yelling mumbo jumbo into his face as  Connor jumps up and down in his chair in rage, wanting a  piece of the action. Murphy throws the man down and Connor proceeds to vicious kick his dead body. The two have turned into barbarians. Murphy removes the man's two guns, shiny nickel-plated 45

head_text.subj: INT. YAKAVETTA'S FRONT FOYER NIGHT

text: There is a knock at the door. Geno jumps with fright and  then looks out the peep hole. He sees a well-formed pair woman's breasts in a cheap dress. He opens the door. A  stunning blonde stands before him. She looks like a hooke She wears a short, hot pink dress and a white scarf aroun her neck, as well as six inch platform heels.
Joey Bevo sent me over. As  entertainment.
The woman speaks and it is apparent that this is actually Smecker in drag.
Listen baby. Tonight ain't the night  for this shit.  (beat) Bevo's so great. Always sending us  hot girls.
You look like you could use a quickie.
Smecker kisses him full on the lips and rubs up against h Geno is convinced. He brings her inside.
Hey, Chappy!
(Chappy, emerges way  down the hall) What the fuck?
I ain't been laid in a week. Take  five minutes.
If I die cause you're getting a piece  of ass, I'll come back and beat you  to death with a big rubber dick.
Don't worry about it.

head_text.subj: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE NIGHT

text: He takes Smecker into a small bathroom adjoining the foye They are instantly in the throws of passion. They grope e other and Smecker cleverly avoids any contact with his cr Smecker lies down on the floor and starts to wiggle and  seductively touch himself. Geno stands over him, straddli Smecker's hips as he undoes his pants. Suddenly, Smecker  grabs both of Geno's ankles and has him locked in positio He repeatedly kicks Geno in the balls from his lying posi on the floor. The guy falls on his back unconscious. Smec uses a silencer, shoots him in the head.

head_text.subj: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE HALL NIGHT

text: He starts to whisper, "It's on now. It's on now. Too far. as he walks down the hall, striding in his high heels, wi back in place. He thoughtlessly blows Chappy away as he p his position and runs down a long hallway. He turns a cor and points his gun at the Mafioso cohort but pauses. He is already sitting with his throat cut. Smecker looks  puzzled as Il Duce withdraws from the shadows behind him. The Duke pistol whips Smecker. He's out.

head_text.subj: INT. YAKAVETTA'S HOUSE BASEMENT ROOM NIGHT

text: Connor and Murphy are on their knees in front of Rocco, w they have sat back up in the chair. They are gently placi pennies in his eye and sobbing as they begin to recite th prayer. As they speak, Il Duce watches. He then begins to whisper the prayer right along with them. Their words mat up perfectly. He leans against the wall, holsters his gun and withdraws a cigarette. He rolls it along his tongue and twists it into his lips. The boys are still reciting as he strikes a match. They r instantly. Still kneeling they each point a nickel-plated toward The Duke. They turn in time to see the light from match illuminate his face. Il Duce pauses then he strides into the room and proceeds to recite the last half of the prayer. He stops between the kneeling boys and finishes off the  prayer. The boys are stunned as they realize this is thei father. He makes the sign of the cross over Rocco. Then h looks down to the upturned faces of his sons. He places a hand on each of their cheeks.

head_text.subj: INT. CHEAP BOSTON HOTEL ROOM NIGHT 3 MONTHS LATER

text: Both sleeping boys throw their arms out, mimicking a cruc Christ. Their father turns, sees this, turns back. The boys wake with a start. Connor looks to his father, w is already staring at him.
How far are we going with this, Da?
The questions is not, "how far?" The  question is, "Do you possess the  constitution, the depth of faith to  go as far as is needed?"

head_text.subj: INT. COURTHOUSE BACK FOYER AREA MORNING

text: Smecker opens the door from the inside and lets the MacMa father and sons in. He walks one way they walk the other  through the grand courthouse halls.

head_text.subj: INT. COURTROOM MORNING

text: The media, with their cameras and notebooks, are at the b of the courtroom. Yakavetta is testifying on the stand. H is cocky. The judge warns Yakavetta that he will have no  more of this behavior in his courtroom.
(whispering to #2) Look at his charisma. He's the next  John Gotti.
He'll walk. Even with all this  evidence.

Look. (points to the left  and right sections  of courtroom seating) All Yakavetta's people are on the  right. All the families of the men  he has killed are on the left.  Everyone wants some justice.
Look at him. He doesn't have a care  in the world. He's gonna walk.

head_text.subj: INT. FOYER TO COURTROOM DAY

text: The MacManusus stand in the foyer. There are a pair of do that go to the outside hallway and a pair that go to the  inside courtroom. There is an armed guard directly inside the courtroom, in front of the doors. The door opens a crack and Connor waves the guard into th foyer and starts talking to him. Then dad zaps him with a stun gun. The guard is on the floor, incapacitated and  drooling as the boys handcuff him. Connor pulls out a length of chain and drapes it through door handles that lead from the hall into the foyer. He l them in with a padlock.
How long do these put a man down  for?
Ten minutes.
The father zaps the incapacitated man a second time as he lay.
Twenty is a bit better.

They suit up, Connor and Murphy in their usual masks and  gloves, Dad is already in his usual dark hat and glasses. The boys start for the courtroom door but dad gently hold them back. He takes a moment, then slowly removes his hat and glasses. His sons look at one another and then remove their masks. The three look into each others eyes for a  moment.

head_text.subj: INT. COURTROOM DAY

text: Due to the lack of hard evidence......
The three burst in, guns drawn, and are walking down the  aisle.
All media to the back! Drop the  cameras! Drop 'em!

Terrified, they all obey. Connor and Murphy pull Yakavett from the witness booth by his hair and place him on his k just before the judge's bench. They face him toward the  occupants of the courtroom. The father walks up and motio for the judge, who is now banging his gavel and shouting protest, to come off the stand. As soon as he is within arms reach, dad takes him by the  collar and drags him down the aisle all the way to where media stands in horror. He turns and walks back down the  aisle.
(loudly) You people have been chosen to reveal  our existence to the world. You will  witness what happens here today and  you will tell of it afterwards.
All eyes to the front.
(looking to his  comrades) Fuckin' do something!

The father keeps them covered. He passes the front, he lo and sees a VIRGINAL-LOOKING WOMAN with her head down cryi into her hands. She is on the left side. He gently tilts chin forward, her eyes fixated on a faded blue butterfly the back of his hand.
(whispers) You must watch dear. It'll all be  over soon.  (she obeys)

The father takes out a flask. He pours the booze on the j bench and set it ablaze. Fire alarms start to sound. Connor and Murphy jump up on the lawyers' tables. Murphy the prosecution side, Connor on the defense. The father h his sawed-off to the back of Yakavetta's head.
(yelling over the  alarm) Now, you will receive us.
(yelling over the  alarm) We do not ask for your poor or your  hungry.
We do not want your tired and sick.
It is your corrupt we claim.
It is your evil, who will be sought  by us.
With every breath we shall hunt them  down.
Each day we will spill their blood  till it rains down from the skies.
Do not kill, do not rape, do not  steal. These are principles which  every man of every faith can embrace.
These are not polite suggestions.  They are codes of behavior and those  that ignore them will pay the dearest  cost. (points to Yakavetta)
There are varying degrees of evil.  We urge you lesser forms of filth (pointing to  Yakavetta's people) Not to push the bounds and cross  over into true corruption... into  our domain.
For if you do, there will come the  day when you look behind you and see  we three. And on that day you will  reap it.
And we will send you to whatever God  you wish.

Connor and Murphy jump off the table. They approach Yakav and stand on either side of their father. All three men h guns to his head and recite the prayer. As they speak, th right side of the courtroom screams in protest. The left  watches in wide-eyed terror, although some men encourage  them to do it. The MacManus' read the prayer. They do not falter as the flames rage behind them. Yakavetta, accepting his fate, closing his eyes. Peaceful he does the sign of the cross. The all fire at once. The  room explodes in confusion. The three exit the back.

location: LONG CEMENT HALLWAY SUBLEVEL OF COURTHOUSE

text: The MacManuses are all shackled and in blue jumpsuits of Boston lock-up facility with bags over their heads. Duffy in full uniform with a shotgun behind them. Smecker is le the prisoners down the hall. He flashes his F.B.I.  identification to every cop he encounters.

head_text.subj: INT. COURTHOUSE INSIDE GRANDE FOYER STEPS DAY

text: The media is in a frenzy. Little bits of the story are kn The people from the left and right sides of the courtroom are yelling and pushing each other as cameras and microph try to pick up the news. Finally all the focus comes to t virginal woman who had been sitting in the front row. All lights, cameras and microphones are on her.
Yes! Were you in the courtroom miss?  Did you see?
(frail) Yes. I was there.
How do you feel about what they did?
(Slo-mo) She sees at the grande hall's end Smecker leadin the three out, bags still over their heads. She sees Dad' butterfly tattoo. She knows.
I guess we all know what is right  and wrong. We all know. Nobody needs  to be convinced of what he was...  I'm going home now to have my first  real full night's sleep.

The people who had been on Yakavetta's side of the courtr threaten her and force their way through the crowd toward her, thus causing the two sides to fight. Everyone, even  reporters are in it. The camera tilts up ending on the st of the Blind Lady of Justice.
